Description: KUJAWSKI CONSULTING PROPOSES TO IMPLEMENT THE DELAY LINE DETECTOR ARCHITECTURE FOR THE TECHS INSTRUMENT AND PROVIDE THE FPGA FIRMWARE DESIGN NEEDED TO INTERPRET THE DATA FROM THE DELAY LINE BOARD. THE NEW DELAY LINE DETECTOR BOARD WILL LEVERAGE THE PREVIOUSLY DESIGNED RIGID-FLEX DELAY LINE BOARD TO COMPLETE THE INTEGRATION OF THIS DESIGN CONCEPT INTO THE TECHS FORM FACTOR. THE FPGA DEVELOPMENT WILL TARGET THE VISIONS II C&DH BOARD AND ASSUMES THAT ONE OF THESE BOARDS IS PROVIDED BY NASA/GSFC FOR USE WITH THIS PROJECT.

FOR THIS PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE  WE WANT TO PURSUE THREE MAIN TASKS. UNDER THIS PROPOSED WORK  WE WOULD COMPLETE TASKS 1 AND 2. IF ADDITIONAL FUNDS ALLOW  WE WOULD COMPLETE TASK 3.TASK 1: MAINTAIN THE CUBESAT DATABASE  AND EXPAND THE DATA COLLECTED. WE WILL CONTINUE TO COLLECT INFORMATION FROM MISSION DEVELOPERS (CHECKED AGAINST OUR OWN INFORMATION)  USING THE TOOLS DEVELOPED UNDER THE PREVIOUS GRANT. WE WILL EXPAND THE DATABASE TO INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ITEMS: A NUMERIC INDICATION OF THERMAL ANALYSIS/DESIGN/VERIFICATION; A NUMERIC INDICATION OF MISSION COMPLEXITY; PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES (AS LISTED ABOVE).TASK 2: TEST CORRELATIONS BETWEEN THERMAL DESIGN  PROGRAM CLASSIFICATION  AND MISSION SUCCESS. AS NOTED  ABOVE  WE BELIEVE THAT A MISSION WITH DETAILED THERMAL DESIGN/ANALYSIS/TESTING WILL CORRELATE STRONGLY WITH THE PROFESSIONAL PROGRAMS  AND ALSO CORRELATE STRONGLY WITH MISSION SUCCESS. WE ARE ALSO INTERESTED IN USING THIS AS A HEURISTIC FOR CLASSIFYING THE PROGRAMS.WE ANTICIPATE UPDATING THE DATABASE WITH THE NEW DATA FIELDS BY OCTOBER 2016  WITH PRELIMINARY NEW DATA COLLECTED BY DECEMBER 2016 (TASK 1). WE WOULD SPEND THE FIRST FOUR MONTHS OF 2017 ON TASK 2 WHILE CONTINUOUSLY UPDATING THE DATABASE.WE WOULD DISSEMINATE THE RESULTS OF THIS WORK IN THREE WAYS: THE DATABASE UPDATE AND RESULTS WOULD BE PRESENTED AT THE JUNE 2017 NEPP WORKSHOP; THE RESULTS OF TASK 2 WOULD FORM THE BASIS OF A MASTERS THESIS BY THE PI'S GRADUATE STUDENT (MAY 2017); AND A FINAL REPORT WOULD BE PROVIDED AT THE END OF THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE. DEPENDING ON HOW WELL THE FINDINGS WERE CORRELATED  WE WOULD EXPECT TO PRESENT THIS WORK AT THE 2017 SMALLSAT CONFERENCE AND PUBLISH IN THE JOURNAL OF SMALL SATELLITES.IF FOLLOW-ON FUNDS WERE AVAILABLE IN 2016-2017  WE WOULD PERFORM TASK 3:TASK 3: TEST CORRELATIONS BETWEEN MISSION COMPLEXITY  DEVELOPMENT SCHEDULE AND MISSION SUCCESS.AS NOTED  ABOVE  WE BELIEVE THAT A SIGNIFICANT SOURCE OF ON-ORBIT FAILURES IS INADEQUATE TIME DEVOTED TO FUNCTIONAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL TESTING. AND ONE REASON FOR THE LACK OF TIME IS THAT THESE PROGRAMS RUN OVER SCHEDULE DURING DEVELOPMENT  FORCING THEM TO ELIMINATE TESTING ACTIVITIES IN ORDER TO MEET THE LAUNCH DATE.TASK 3 WOULD BE PURSUED IN SPRING 2017 IN PARALLEL WITH TASK 2  AND CONTINUING INTO THE SUMMER.

UNDERSTANDING THE DYNAMIC BEHAVIOR OF THE SATELLITE BODIES AND DISTRIBUTED  CONDUCTIVE TETHER ARE CRITICAL TO LONG-RANGE DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT OF THE E-SAIL CONCEPT. THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF THIS MODEL ARE TO FIRST CHARACTERIZE THE SYSTEM PERFORMANCE DURING THE DEPLOYMENT TRANSIENT EVENT  EVALUATE PERFORMANCE CHARACTERISTICS DURING OPERATION  AND TO IDENTIFY ANY AREAS OF INSTABILITY THAT POSE A THREAT TO STABLE OPERATION. THIS TASK FOCUSES ON CONTINUED DEVELOPMENT OF THE TENNESSEE TECHNOLOGICAL UNIVERSITY (TTU) TETHER SIMULATION MODEL. THE TTU TETHER SIMULATION WILL BE USED TO MODEL THE KEY OPERATIONS INVOLVED IN TETHER SAIL ORBITAL MAINTENANCE AND MANEUVERING OPERATIONS. IT SHOULD BE NOTED THAT THE COMPLETE DYNAMIC BEHAVIOR OF TETHER DEPLOYMENT SYSTEMS PRESENTS CHALLENGES TO PLANNING AND DESIGN OF TETHER-BASED STRUCTURES  SUCH AS COUPLING BETWEEN TRANSVERSE AND LONGITUDINAL MODES  OUT-OF-PLANE LIBRATIONS  AND POTENTIAL CHAOTIC EVENTS AS A FUNCTION OF INITIAL CONDITIONS. THIS STUDY WILL BRING TOGETHER AND IMPLEMENT MODELS FOR THE TETHER/SAIL SYSTEM IN THE LIGHT OF THE CURRENT DYNAMIC MODEL THEORY TO IDENTIFY A COMBINATION OF THE FEASIBILITY AS WELL AS THE PRIMARY RISKS THAT NEED TO BE ADDRESSED IN DEVELOPING THE TETHER/SAILS CONCEPT.

THE OVERALL OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROPOSAL IS TO USE THE LONG-TERM MEASUREMENTS OF BOUNDARY LAYER CLOUD  SURFACE AEROSOL  AND ANCILLARY METEOROLOGICAL MEASUREMENTS FROM THREE DOE ARM SITES (ALASKA  OKLAHOMA  AND AZORES) AS A TEST BED FOR ADVANCING PARAMETERIZATIONS OF THE COUPLING OF AEROSOL AND CLOUD MICROPHYSICS IN MODELE.

THIS PROJECT INCLUDES TESTING THE FLAMMABILITY AND CORROSION RESISTANCE OF VARIOUS NEWLY DEVELOPEDMAGNESIUM (MG) ALLOYS COMPARED TO CONVENTIONAL AEROSPACE METALLIC ALLOYS (ALUMINUM  STAINLESS STEEL)AND POLYMER MATRIX COMPOSITE (PMC) STRUCTURAL MATERIALS TO DETERMINE POTENTIAL USAGE IN SPACE ASSECONDARY STRUCTURE OR OTHER NON STRUCTURAL  NON FRACTURE CRITICAL SPACECRAFT HARDWARE.

THE GLAF SOFTWARE DEVELOPED AT VIRGINIA TECH PROVIDES AN INTUITIVE  VISUAL PROGRAMMING INTERFACE WITH ANAUTO-PARALLELIZING AND AUTO-TUNING FRAMEWORK THAT AUTOMATICALLY GENERATES EFFICIENT SERIAL AND PARALLELFORTRAN AND C CODE. THIS APPROACH PROVIDES A BALANCE BETWEEN PERFORMANCE AND PROGRAMMABILITY. THE CURRENT VERSION OF GLAF TARGETS SHARED-MEMORY PARALLEL COMPUTERS  NAMELY SINGLE MULTI-CORE NODES SUCH AS INTEL XEONS (E.G.  BROADWELL  HASWELL  ETC.)  XEON PHI CO-PROCESSORS  AND NVIDIA GPUS (ACCELERATORS). THIS EFFORT EVALUATES GLAF VISUAL PROGRAMMING INTERFACE AND ITS AUTO-TUNING FRAMEWORK FOR SUITABILITY AND APPLICABILITY AS A PARALLEL PROGRAMMING APPROACH FOR APPLICATIONS IN BOTH THE CLIMATE SCIENCE BRANCH (E302)AND FROM THE RESEARCH DIRECTORATE (RD). NAMELY  LARC WILL IDENTIFY REASONABLY SIZED SINGLE-NODEAPPLICATIONS OR STANDALONE CODE SEGMENTS (I.E.  COMPUTATIONAL KERNELS  OR MINI-APPLICATIONS)  AND VATECH ANDLARC WILL DEMONSTRATE AND CREATE SIMILAR GLAF REPRESENTATIONS. THIS WILL EXERCISE AND DEMONSTRATE THE USEOF THE GUI TO REPRESENT THE PROBLEM DOMAIN (IN SERIAL AND PARALLEL)  DEMONSTRATE THE CODE GENERATION AND COMPILATION  AND EVALUATE THE PERFORMANCE BETWEEN THE ORIGINAL AND THE GLAF GENERATED CODE ON CPUS  XEON PHIS  AND NVIDIA GPUS. GLAF = GRID-BASED LANGUAGE AND AUTO-PARALLELIZING  AUTO-TUNING FRAMEWORK

THE DEPARTMENT OF ASTRONOMY AT THE UNIVERSITY OF MARYLAND HAS ESTABLISHED MULTIPLE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS WITH THE GODDARD SPACE FLIGHT CENTER (GSFC) TO CONDUCT MISSION SPECIFIC RESEARCH IN THE PLANETARY SCIENCES. THIS PARTICULAR AGREEMENT WILL CONTINUE TO FACILITATE UNINTERRUPTED RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT OF NEXT GENERATION SPECTROSCOPIC INSTRUMENTATION USED IN EARTH-BASED AND SPACE-BASED STUDIES OF PLANETARY ATMOSPHERES BY AN EXPERIENCED SCIENTIST  NAMELY DR. TILAK HEWAGAMA. DR. HEWAGAMA HAS BEEN WORKING ON THESE NEW TECHNOLOGIES FOR SEVERAL YEARS AND IS WELL AWARE OF THEIR SCIENTIFIC APPLICATIONS AND THE ENGINEERING AND OPERATIONAL CHALLENGES ASSOCIATED WITH THEM. UNDER THIS AGREEMENT. DR. HEWAGAMA  A UMD EMPLOYEE WORKING AT GSFC  WILL ALSO SUPPORT TWO PROGRAMS NEW TO HIM  THE OSIRIS-REX AND JUNO MISSIONS. DR. HEWAGAMA WILL SPECIFICALLY SUPPORT THE CALIBRATION OF THE OSIRIS-REX VISIBLE AND INFRARED SPECTROMETER (OVIRS)  WORKING WITH THE TEAM TO CONSTRUCT  MAINTAIN AND IMPROVE  AS NECESSARY  A MASTER CALIBRATION TO BE DELIVERED TO THE OSIRIS-REX SCIENCE PROCESSING AND OPERATIONS CENTER FOR USE IN PIPELINE PROCESSING OF ASTEROID BENNU MEASUREMENTS. DR. HEWAGAMA WILL ALSO SUPPORT THE JUNO MISSION ATMOSPHERIC VOLATILE STUDIES OF JUPITER BY ACQUIRING NEW HIGH SPECTRAL AND SPATIAL RESOLUTION GROUND-BASED INFRARED OBSERVATIONS OF JUPITER. DR. HEWAGAMA  VERY KNOWLEDGEABLE IN RADIATIVE TRANSFER IN PLANETARY ATMOSPHERES  WILL IMPLEMENT RADIATIVE TRANSFER MODELS TO AID IN INTERPRETING THE OBSERVATIONS.

THE PURPOSED RESEARCH WILL PROVIDE A MEANS TO EFFICIENTLY AND AUTONOMOUSLU DESIGN ASTEROID AND PLANERARY SATELLITE TOURS  WHICH AR CAPABILITIES BEYOND THE CURRENT SCOPE OF THE STATE OF THE ART METHODS AVAILABLE TO GSFC ENGINEERS.

CONTAMINATION RESISTANT LEADING EDGES USING POLYMER-FILLED  COMPOSITE METAL FOAMS RAIN  ICE  AND PARTICULATES ERODE THE METALLIC LEADING EDGES OF COMMERCIAL TRANSPORT AIRCRAFT REQUIRING REWORK AND REPLACEMENT EVERY 5 TO 10 YEARS. IN SUCH AN EROSIVE ENVIRONMENT  POLYMER COATINGS AND COMPOSITES LIKE THOSE IN WIND TURBINE BLADES HAVE VERY SHORT LIFETIMES. IN ADDITION  METALLIC LEADING EDGES ACCUMULATE ICE AND OTHER DEBRIS THAT CAN DEGRADE FLIGHT PERFORMANCE  COMPROMISE SAFETY  AND REQUIRE ONBOARD DE-ICING DEVICES  WHICH ARE EXPENSIVE AND HEAVY. A MATERIAL WITH THE DURABILITY OF METALS AND THE ANTI-ICING/DEBRIS MITIGATION PROPERTIES OF FUNCTIONALIZED POLYMERS HAS HIGH POTENTIAL TO IMPROVE AIRCRAFT EFFICIENCY AND SAFETY WHILE REDUCING MANUFACTURING AND OPERATION COSTS. POLYMER FILLED METAL FOAMS HAVE SPECIFIC APPLICATIONS FOR N+3 AIRCRAFT SURFACE TO PREVENT THE INGESTION OF FOREIGN OBJECTS ON BLENDED WING BODY OR DOUBLE BUBBLE AIRCRAFT. ON CURRENT AIRCRAFT  THE WEIGHT OF THE LEADING EDGE COULD BE REDUCED BY 50% TO 70%. MULTIFUNCTIONAL MATERIALS TO IMPROVE FLIGHT EFFICIENCY AND SAFETY ARE CORE COMPONENTS OF NASAS MISSION AND ALIGN WELL WITH LANGLEYS STRATEGIC INVESTMENT PLAN.

GLOBAL NAVIGATION SATELLITE SYSTEM (GNSS) BISTATIC RADARS USE THE EXISTING CONSTELLATIONS OF NAVIGATION SATELLITES (GPS  GALILEO  ETC.) AS THE TRANSMIT HALF OF A BISTATIC RADAR LINK. THE RECEIVE HALF OF THE LINK IS A CUSTOMIZED GNSS RECEIVER DESIGNED SPECIFICALLY FOR REMOTE SENSING APPLICATIONS. THE CURRENT STATE OF THE ART IN THESE RECEIVERS AT THE TRL-6 OR HIGHER LEVEL IS EXEMPLIFIED BY THE SCIENCE PAYLOAD CARRIED ON NASA S CYGNSS MISSION CONSTELLATION OF SMALL SATELLITES. THIS RECEIVER DEMONSTRATED  DURING A RECENT TRL RAISING TECHNOLOGY DEMONSTRATION MISSION  THAT IT IS CAPABLE OF MEASURING OCEAN SURFACE WINDS  NEAR SURFACE SOIL MOISTURE  SEA SURFACE HEIGHT (ALTIMETRY)  AND POLAR ICE EXTENT FROM LOW EARTH ORBIT. THE CURRENT RECEIVER CAN ONLY PROCESS AT MOST FOUR SIMULTANEOUS MEASUREMENTS AND CAN ONLY USE THE L1 SIGNAL TRANSMITTED BY THE GPS SATELLITE CONSTELLATION. THE USE OF ONLY L1 SIGNALS LIMITS THE HORIZONTAL RESOLUTION (FOR OCEAN WIND  SOIL MOISTURE AND ICE EXTENT APPLICATIONS) AND THE VERTICAL RESOLUTION (FOR ALTIMETRY). THE PROCESSING OF AT MOST FOUR SIGNALS AND ONLY FROM GPS SATELLITES LIMITS THE SPATIAL SAMPLING AND REVISIT TIME FOR ALL APPLICATIONS. A NEXT GENERATION GNSS BISTATIC RADAR RECEIVER WILL BE DEVELOPED THAT IS CAPABLE OF PROCESSING SIGNALS TRANSMITTED BY BOTH GPS AND GALILEO SATELLITES  INCLUDING BOTH LOW (L1/E1) AND HIGH (L5/E5) BANDWIDTH SIGNALS. THE RECEIVER WILL ALSO BE CAPABLE OF PROCESSING BETWEEN 7 (MINIMUM) AND 14 (GOAL) SIMULTANEOUS SIGNALS. AS A DIRECT CONSEQUENCE OF THESE HARDWARE AND FIRMWARE DEVELOPMENTS  HORIZONTAL RESOLUTION WILL BE IMPROVED BY A FACTOR OF THREE  VERTICAL RESOLUTION BY A FACTOR OF TEN  AND SPATIAL COVERAGE AND REVISIT TIME BY A FACTOR OF TWO (MINIMUM) TO FOUR (GOAL). IN TERMS OF THE IMPACT OF THESE PERFORMANCE ENHANCEMENTS ON THE SCIENTIFIC VALUE OF REMOTELY SENSED GEOPHYSICAL PROPERTIES  THE IMPROVEMENTS RANGE FROM SIGNIFICANT BUT INCREMENTAL TO FUNDAMENTALLY ENABLING. EXAMPLES OF SIGNIFICANT INCREMENTAL IMPROVEMENTS ARE THE MEASUREMENT OF OCEAN SURFACE WINDS AND ICE EXTENT. THE IMPROVED SPATIAL RESOLUTION WILL  FOR EXAMPLE  ENABLE FINER SPATIAL SCALE STRUCTURE TO BE RESOLVED IN STORMS AND SMALLER LEADS AND TONGUES TO BE IMAGED AT THE POLAR ICE EDGE. EXAMPLES OF ENABLING IMPROVEMENTS ARE IN THE AREAS OF SEA LEVEL CHANGE AND FLOOD PREDICTION. THE ABILITY TO MEASURE SEA SURFACE HEIGHT WITH 10X HIGHER ACCURACY WILL PLACE GNSS METHODS IN THE SAME GENERAL RANGE OF PERFORMANCE AS EXISTING SATELLITE ALTIMETER MISSIONS. THE ABILITY TO MEASURE SOIL MOISTURE WITH HIGH SPATIAL AND TEMPORAL RESOLUTION WILL ENABLE SOIL SATURATION MONITORING DURING POTENTIAL FLASH FLOOD EVENTS. IN THESE AND OTHER WAYS  THE NEXT GENERATION GNSS BISTATIC RADAR RECEIVER WILL ENABLE MAJOR IMPROVEMENTS IN CLIMATE STUDIES  WEATHER MONITORING AND PREDICTION  DISASTER MANAGEMENT  AND USES BY COMMERCIAL MARITIME ORGANIZATIONS. THIS THREE YEAR EFFORT WILL RAISE THE TECHNOLOGY READINESS OF A NEXT GENERATION GNSS BISTATIC RADAR RECEIVER FROM TRL-4 TO TRL-6.

DEEP-DIRECTED ENERGY FOR INTERSTELLAR PROPULSIONWE PROPOSE TO EXPAND OUR INVESTIGATIONS STARTED IN OUR NIAC PHASE I OF USING DIRECTED ENERGY TO ALLOW THE ACHIEVEMENT OF RELATIVISTIC FLIGHT TO PAVE THE WAY TO THE FIRST INTERSTELLAR MISSIONS. ALL OF THE CURRENT CONVENTIONAL PROPULSION SYSTEMS ARE INCAPABLE OF REACHING THE HIGH SPEEDS NECESSARY TO ENABLE INTERSTELLAR FLIGHT. DIRECTED ENERGY OFFERS A PATH FORWARD THAT  WHILE DIFFICULT  IS FEASIBLE. IT IS NOT AN EASY PATH AND IT DOES HAVE MANY MILESTONES TO CROSS IN ORDER TO GET TO THE POINT OF ACHIEVING THE SPEEDS NEEDED. ALONG THE ROADMAP WE PROPOSE ARE IMPORTANT AND USEFUL  WAYPOINTS  THAT BOTH ALLOW TESTING AND FEED BACK TO THE LARGER DESIGN BUT ARE ALSO USEFUL FOR MANY APPLICATIONS. THE CONSEQUENCES OF THIS PROGRAM ARE TRULY TRANSFORMATIVE NOT ONLY FOR ACHIEVING RELATIVISTIC FLIGHT FOR SMALL PROBES BUT ALSO FOR LARGER SPACECRAFT AT LOWER SPEEDS SUITABLE FOR RAPID INTERPLANETARY TRAVEL. THE RESEARCH THAT WILL BE CONDUCTED IN ITS BROADEST SENSE IS EXPERIMENTALLY MEASURING THE ELECTRIC FIELD THAT IS USED IN MICROSCALE PROPULSION DEVICES. THE KEY OBJECTIVES ARE ENGRAINED IN BOTH PROOF-OF-CONCEPT  AND DEVELOPMENT OF A TECHNIQUE TO MAKE THIS MEASUREMENT AROUND A DYNAMIC CONICAL FEATURE CALLED A TAYLOR CONE. LITERATURE SHOWS THAT THE TECHNIQUE  CALLED ELECTRON HOLOGRAPHY  HAS BEEN SUCCESSFULLY USED TO MEASURE THE ELECTRIC FIELD OF SIMILAR SIZED SOLID FEATURES. THERE IS ALSO LITERATURE THAT PROVES IMAGING OF TAYLOR CONES IS POSSIBLE IN THE TRANSMISSION ELECTRON MICROSCOPE USED FOR ELECTRON HOLOGRAPHY. THIS RESEARCH  WOULD THEREFORE BRIDGE THIS GAP IN LITERATURE AND PROVIDE A EXPERIMENTAL DATA THAT CAN BE USED TO SOLVE PROBLEMS SEEN IN RECENT ELECTRIC PROPULSION MODELINGAND EXPERIMENTS.THE HYPOTHESIS THAT WILL BE TESTED IN THIS EXPERIMENT IS THE FOLLOWING  IF AN OPERATING IONIC LIQUID TAYLOR CONE SUBJECTED TO CHANGES IN THE LOCAL ELECTRIC FIELD  THEN THE MEASURED EMISSION CURRENT WILL FOLLOW A PROPORTIONAL TREND WITH RESPECT TO AN INCREASE IN ELECTRIC FIELD.IN ORDER TO TEST THIS HYPOTHESIS  THE FOLLOWING QUESTIONS MUST BE ANSWERED: 1) HOW DOES THE ASPECT RATIO OF THESE SHARP TIPS AFFECT THE FORMATION OF THE TAYLOR CONE?2) IS IT POSSIBLE TO MEASURE THE SPATIAL ELECTRIC FIELD IN THE NEAR FIELD OF AN OPERATING TAYLOR CONE?3) HOW DO VARIATIONS IN THE LOCAL ELECTRIC FIELD AFFECT THE OPERATION OF AN IONIC LIQUID ELECTROSPRAY THRUSTER?TO ANSWER THE FIRST QUESTION THREE EXPERIMENTS WILL BE CONDUCTED USING THE TWO IN SITU VISUALIZATION TECHNIQUES PREVIOUSLY DESCRIBED. THE EXPERIMENTS WILL USE A HITACHI S4700 FIELD-EMISSION SCANNING ELECTRON MICROSCOPE (FE-SEM)  A FEI TITAN 80-300 ENVIRONMENTAL TRANSMISSION ELECTRON MICROSCOPE (E-TEM) WITH AN INTEGRATED MOLLENSTEDT BIPRISM  AND A JEOL JEM-4000FX TRANSMISSION ELECTRONMICROSCOPE (TEM)  RESPECTIVELY. I HAVE SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED THE FE-SEM EXPERIMENTS USING AN UNCOATED SHARP TUNGSTEN TIP AS THE CATHODE. THE FIRST TEM EXPERIMENT WILL USE THE ELECTRON HOLOGRAPHY TECHNIQUE TO IMAGE THE SPATIAL ELECTRIC FIELD IN THE REGION AROUND AN UNCOATED TUNGSTEN TIP OF VARYING TIP RADII. THESE TEM RESULTS WILL THEN BE USED AS A MEANS OF COMPARISON FOR THE SEM MICROGRAPHS. FROM THE RESULTS OF THESE TWO EXPERIMENTS WILL HELP IN SELECTING THE PROPER RANGE OF TIP RADII FOR USE IN THE COATED TIPEXPERIMENTS. THE SECOND TEM EXPERIMENT WILL IMPLEMENT AN IONIC-LIQUID-COATED TUNGSTEN TIP TO PRODUCE AND IMAGE A STABLE TAYLOR CONE. MULTIPLE TIPS WITH VARYING TIP RADII WILL BE TESTING UNTIL A TAYLOR CONE FORMATION IS DEMONSTRATED. AS SUCH  THIS TEM EXPERIMENTWILL FOCUS ON IMAGING AN IONIC LIQUID TAYLOR CONE FORMING ON A TUNGSTEN TIP AND WILL NOT USE ANY ELECTRIC FIELD MEASUREMENT TECHNIQUES.TO ANSWER THE SECOND QUESTION THE FEI TITAN 80-300 E-TEM WILL BE USED TO RUN EXPERIMENTS ON OPERATING IONIC LIQUID TAYLOR CONES. THE ELECTRON HOLOGRAPHY TECHNIQUE WILL BE USED AGAIN  THIS TIME TO IMAGE THE SPATIAL ELECTRIC FIELD SURROUNDING STABLE TAYLOR CONES.ONCE VISUALIZATION OF THE ELECTRIC FIELD AROUND OPERATION TAYLOR CONES IS DEMONSTRATED  IMAGES WILL BE TAKEN AT DIFFERENT APPLIED VOLTAGES TO MEASURE THE DETERMINE HOW A CHANGE IN THE ELECTRIC FIELD AFFECTS THE OPERATION OF A TAYLOR CONE. TO ANSWER THE THIRD QUESTION  EMISSION CURRENT CAN BE MEASURED CONCURRENTLY WITH IMAGE CAPTURE TO OBSERVE THE EFFECT THE LOCAL ELECTRIC FIELD HAS ON EMISSION CURRENT.THIS RESEARCH WOULD BE A SIGNIFICANT STEP IN CHALLENGES CURRENTLY SEEN IN THE MICROPROPULSION ARENA. SPECIFICALLY  WITHIN NASA S IN-SPACE PROPULSION TABS  CHALLENGES IN MEMS ELECTROSPRAY TECHNOLOGY THAT COULD BE SOLVED WOULD BE THE ABILITY TO DESIGN POWER EFFICIENT ELECTROSPRAY THRUSTERS. UNDERSTANDING THE EXPERIMENTALLY MEASURED RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN THE LOCAL ELECTRIC FIELD AND TAYLOR CONE OPERATION  OR LOCAL ELECTRIC FIELD AND THE EMISSION CURRENT COULD ALSO LEAD TO SOLUTIONS IN DISTRIBUTION OF PROPELLANT ON EMITTER TIPS.

NOVEL CONTROL TECHNIQUES FOR HAND AND WRIST ROBOTIC REHABILITATIONTHE PROPOSED ADAPTIVE CONTROL IN THIS PROPOSAL HAS APPLICATIONS IN EXOSKELETONS USED FOR RESISTIVE EXERCISES BOTH DURING AND AFTER SPACE MISSIONS  AND IN THE EXOSKELETONS USED FOR POWER AUGMENTATION OF THE HAND AND WRIST. THE UTILIZATION OF THIS TYPE OF HAND AND WRIST EXOSKELETON COULD IMPROVE THE DEXTERITY OF THE OPERATOR WHILE COMBATING THE EFFECTS OF FATIGUE ALLOWING FOR LONGER  MORE EFFECTIVE  AND SAFER MISSIONS INVOLVING EXTRA-VEHICULAR ACTIVITY. THE ORIGINAL IMPETUS FOR AN ADAPTIVE CONTROL AROSE OUT OF ADVANCEMENTS IN THE FIELD OF REHABILITATION ROBOTICS  SPECIFICALLY IN STROKE AND SPINAL CORD INJURY REHABILITATION. MANY OF THE ADVANCEMENTS MADE INREHABILITATION ROBOTICS HAVE EITHER COME FROM OR HAVE BEEN TRANSFERRED TO EXOSKELETONS AIMED AT HEALTHY USERS  EITHER FOR EXERCISE OR POWER AUGMENTATION. OVER 90% OF THE ESTIMATED 7 000 000 STROKE SURVIVORS (AMERICAN HEART ASSOCIATION  2012) WILL REQUIRE REHABILITATION FOCUSED ON REGAINING FUNCTION IN THE HAND AND WRIST IN ORDER TO REGAIN THE ABILITY TO PERFORM ACTS OF DAILY LIVING AND TO IMPROVE THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE. TOWARDS THIS GOAL  ROBOTIC REHABILITATION HAS BEEN SUCCESSFULLY IMPLEMENTED  PROVIDING A SAFE  ACCURATE WAY TO ADMINISTER THE HIGH INTENSITY  LONG DURATION PHYSICAL THERAPY REQUIRED FOR SUCCESSFUL STROKE REHABILITATION. MUCH ATTENTION HAS BEEN GIVEN TO THE REHABILITATION  EXERCISE  AND POWER AUGMENTATION OF THE LEGS  SHOULDERS  AND ELBOW. HOWEVER  INSUFFICIENT ATTENTIONHAS BEEN PAID TO THE HAND AND WRIST  AND THIS PROPOSAL WILL ADDRESS THIS SHORTCOMING. THE HAND AND WRIST TOGETHER HAVE 27 DEGREES OF FREEDOM  AND DUE TO PACKING AND SIZE CONSTRAINTS  ANY EXOSKELETON WILL LIKELY NOT HAVE THE CAPABILITY TO ACTUATE AND MEASURE EVERY DEGREE OF FREEDOM. IN ORDER TO PREVENT THE EXOSKELETON FROM BECOMING TOO BULKY AND HEAVY FOR PRACTICAL APPLICATIONS  AND TO INSURE SAFE OPERATION  THE DESIGN WILL LIKELY BE A COMPLIANT AND UNDER-ACTUATED. I PROPOSE TO DEVELOP METHODS FOR CONTROLLING AN UNDER-ACTUATED  COMPLIANT HAND AND WRIST EXOSKELETON THAT WILL HAVE APPLICATIONS IN ROBOTIC REHABILITATION  RESISTIVE EXERCISE  AND POWER AUGMENTATION  BY COMBINING THE BENEFITS OF ADAPTIVE  ASSIST-AS-NEEDED CONTROL AND BREAKING DOWN COMPLEX MOTIONS. ASSIST-AS-NEEDED CONTROL IS A TECHNIQUE USED IN ROBOTIC REHABILITATION THAT ESTIMATES A PATIENT'S POWER OUTPUT CAPABILITIES  AND PROVIDES ASSISTANCE ONLY AS A COMPLEMENT TO THE MOTION  FACILITATING THE GAINS IN NEUROPLASTICITY  ESSENTIALLY THE REWIRING OF THE BRAIN  THAT OTHER TECHNIQUES CANNOT. THESE SAME ADAPTIVE CONTROL ALGORITHMS COULD BE USED SIMILARLY TO MAXIMIZE THE EFFICACY OF AN ASTRONAUT'S EXERCISE REGIMEN  OR TO ASSIST DURING AN EVA  EITHER BY HELPING AN ASTRONAUT HOLD ONTO A CERTAIN TOOL  OR PERFORM VARIOUS TASKS REQUIRING GREATER DEXTERITY OR POWER THAN THE ASTRONAUT ALONE CAN PROVIDE. I PROPOSE THAT THE BASIC HAND GRASP POSITIONS FOUND IN THE ROBOTIC MANIPULATOR LITERATURE COULD BE A POTENTIAL SOLUTION TO THE PROBLEM OF UNDER-ACTUATION  AND COULD BE USED TO CREATE A SUBSET OF BUILDING BLOCKS UPON WHICH FUNCTIONAL TASKS ARE BUILT. THE BROKEN DOWN MOTIONS  IN ADDITION TO THEAFOREMENTIONED BENEFITS  HAVE BEEN SHOWN TO IMPROVE STROKE PATIENT OUTCOMES IN TRIALS DOWN ON THE SHOULDER AND ELBOW  BUT HAVE YET TO SEE IMPLEMENTATION ON THE HAND AND WRIST.FIRSTLY  THE REHABILITATION OF THE WRIST AND HAND WILL BE EXPLORING A CRUCIAL AND OVERLOOKED PART OF REHABILITATION ROBOTICS. SECONDLY  THE IMPLICATIONS OF THIS RESEARCH ON THE CRUCIAL AREAS OF SPACE EXERCISE AND EVA SAFETY AND EFFICACY ARE STRONGLY ALIGNED WITH THE GOALS OF THE ROBOTICS  TELE-ROBOTICS  AND AUTONOMOUS SYSTEMS ROADMAP TECHNOLOGY AREA. A LIBS BOROSCOPE FOR EVALUATION OF MARS SAMPLE RETURN CORE CANDIDATESTHE LEADING RECOMMENDATION OF THE DECADAL SURVEY [NATIONAL RESEARCH COUNCIL  2011] IS "...TAKING THE FIRST CRITICAL STEPS TOWARD RETURNING CAREFULLY SELECTED SAMPLES FROM THE SURFACE OF MARS." THIS RESEARCH PROGRAM WILL DEVELOP A LASER-INDUCED BREAKDOWN SPECTROSCOPY (LIBS) BOROSCOPE FOR PERFORMING STRATIGRAPHIC ANALYSES OF THE WALLS OF BOREHOLES LEFT BY A SAMPLING CORER OR DRILL LIKE THOSE ENVISIONED FOR A MARS SAMPLE RETURN (MSR) MISSION. THE PRIMARY PURPOSE OF AN MSR MISSION IS TO BRING SAMPLES TO EARTH  WHERE THEY CAN BE EXAMINED USING THE MOST SOPHISTICATED SCIENTIFIC METHODS. BECAUSE RETURNING SAMPLES IS DIFFICULT  PROPOSED MSR MISSION ARCHITECTURES BUDGET JUST 350 - 500 G FOR SPECIMENS. IN ORDER TO RECONCILE THE CONFLICTING REQUIREMENTS OF SAMPLE DIVERSITY AND LIMITED PAYLOAD  THE MAKEUP OF COLLECTED MATERIALS SHOULD BE MEASURED BEFORE THEY ARE CACHED. DEPTH-PROFILED MEASUREMENTS OF THEBOREHOLE LEFT BY THE CORER OR DRILL AFTER THE SAMPLE IS EXTRACTED WILL YIELD INSIGHT ABOUT A SAMPLE'S STRATA  WHICH CAN BE USED TO CONFIRM OR REJECT ITS SUITABILITY. THE LIBS BOROSCOPE DESCRIBED HERE CAN PERFORM SUCH MEASUREMENTS  WHICH WILL YIELD GEOCHEMICAL CONTEXT FORSPECIMENS WHILE ALSO ENABLING SCIENTISTS TO EVALUATE PHYSIOCHEMICAL CHANGES THAT MIGHT OCCUR DURING CACHE OR RETURN. LIBS WORKS BY IRRADIATING A SAMPLE  IN THIS CASE THE BOREHOLE WALL  WITH A PULSED LASER TO INDUCE PLASMA IGNITION AND ABLATION. THE CONTINUUM AND LINE SPECTRA FROM THE PLASMA SPARK ARE USED TO IDENTIFY ELEMENTAL COMPOSITION AND  USING STANDARD SPECTROSCOPIC PRACTICES  CONSTRAIN THE MOLECULAR MAKEUP. OF THE AVAILABLE INSTRUMENTS  LASER-INDUCED BREAKDOWN SPECTROSCOPY REPRESENTS ONE OF THE BEST METHODS FOR RAPIDLY CHARACTERIZING A WIDE VARIETY OF GEOLOGICAL MATERIALS AND HAS SUITABLE SPATIAL RESOLUTION  DEPTH PROFILING  AND SAMPLE PREPARATION REQUIREMENTS TO BE USED IN BOREHOLE MAPPING. THE PRESENT STUDY WILL FOCUS ON TWO MAIN OBJECTIVES: IMPROVING THE PULSE-TO-PULSE REPEATABILITY OF LIBS MEASUREMENTS AND DEVELOPING A SELF-CONTAINED PROTOTYPE LIBS BOROSCOPE INSTRUMENT FOR TECHNOLOGY-READINESS-LEVEL MATURATION. WITH CONVENTIONAL LIBS INSTRUMENTS  DETECTION LIMITS ARE TYPICALLY AT THE PPM OR PPB LEVEL  BUT THE PULSE-TO-PULSE VARIANCE IS TYPICALLY ON THE ORDER OF 5 - 20 PERCENT. TO IMPROVE THIS  PHASE I OF THE INVESTIGATION WILL FOCUS ON IMPLEMENTING DOUBLE-PULSE EXCITATION  TIME-RESOLVED LINE-RATIO MEASUREMENTS  AS WELL AS MAGNETIC CONFINEMENT AND HELIUM DOUSING. BETWEEN THESE TECHNIQUES  THIS STUDY SEEKS TO REDUCE PULSE-TOPULSE VARIANCE BY AN ORDER OF MAGNITUDE. FINITE ELEMENT MODELING OF SPARK PLASMA EVOLUTION WILL BE CONDUCTED ALONGSIDE BREADBOARD EXPERIMENTS TO QUANTIFY IMPROVEMENTS. THE OPTIMAL INTER-PULSE DELAY  LASER FLUENCE RATIO  HELIUM DOUSE RATE  MAGNETIC FIELD ENERGY RATIO  AND OTHER RESULTS FROM THE PHASE I STUDY WILL BE USED TO INFORM DESIGN OF THE PROTOTYPE INSTRUMENT DURING PHASE II. SYSTEM ENGINEERING OF THE PROTOTYPE WILL BE ANCHORED BY EXISTING OR PROJECTED SPACE TECHNOLOGIES WITH RESPECT TO THE DOUBLE-PULSE LASER SPECTROMETER  AND ROBOTIC MECHANISM CONTROLLING THE OPTICAL PROBE. THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES OF THE LIBS BOROSCOPE INVESTIGATION INCLUDE IMPROVED REPEATABILITY FOR LIBS INSTRUMENTS DESIGNED FOR SPACE AND A PROOF OF CONCEPT FOR THIS NEW MEASUREMENT APPROACH. BASED ON FAVORABLE LABORATORY RESULTS  FLIGHT IMPLEMENTATION OF A LIBS BOROSCOPE FOR AN MSR MISSION COULD MITIGATE RISKS INHERENT TO SAMPLE RETURN AND ALSO YIELD SCIENTIFIC BENEFITS THAT ADD VALUE TO PROCURED SPECIMENS. ADDITIONALLY  THE FELLOWSHIP INVESTIGATION WILL ENABLE THE APPLICANT TO PURSUE HIS GOAL OF WORKING IN SPACE INSTRUMENT DEVELOPMENT.

REEL-TO-REEL DIGITAL MANUFACTURING OF ROBOTIC SYSTEMS\NTHE MASSIVE ENERGY EXPENDITURE REQUIRED TO TRANSPORT OBJECTS OUT OF THE GRAVITY WELL NECESSITA

THE MAJORITY OF DESIGN TO MANUFACTURING TODAY IS STILL AN AD HOC AND EMPIRICAL PROCESS. THERE IS A DIRECT NEED FOR A SINGLE  AUTOMATED DESIGN AND FABRICATION PROCESS. FURTHERMORE  NEW FABRICATION TECHNIQUES AT THE MICRO AND MACRO SCALES PROVIDE NEARLY UNLIMITED DESIGN AND PRODUCT POTENTIAL  FOR WHICH THERE IS NO DESIGN PRECEDENT. EMPIRICAL DESIGN WILL NOT TRANSFER TO THE PROJECTS THAT ARE CAPABLE OF BEING PRODUCED WITH THESE TECHNIQUES (OR EXAMPLE  MOBILE SOFT ROBOTS)  BECAUSE HUMAN INTUITION WILL FAIL WHEN TRYING TO PREDICT THE PERFORMANCE OF NON-LINEAR INTERACTIONS BETWEEN NOVEL MATERIALS AND FORMS AT MULTIPLE SCALES. I PROPOSE THAT EVOLUTIONARY ALGORITHMS(EAS) ARE USED TO ITERATIVELY AND INTERACTIVELY PRODUCE DESIGNS. EAS MIMIC THE TRAITS OF BIOLOGICAL EVOLUTION AND APPLY THEM TO ARTIFICIAL DESIGN OF NOVEL AND UNINTUITIVE SOLUTIONS. THEY HAVE BEEN SHOWN TO CREATE COMPLEX AND INTERESTING FORMS WITH INTERACTIVE FEEDBACK FROM A HUMAN USER  AND ALSO HAVE BEEN SHOWN TO CREATE HIGH PERFORMING SOLUTIONS WHEN LEFT TO OPTIMIZE PRODUCT DESIGN TOWARDS ONE OR MORE OBJECTIVE FEATURE. EXAMPLES OF EA PERFORMANCE INCLUDE A PART DEPLOYED ON THE NASA ST5 SPACECRAFT WHICH OUTPERFORMED ALL OF THE ALTERNATIVE HUMAN DESIGNED SOLUTIONS OR SPECIALIZED CRUMPLE ZONES IN INDUSTRY LEADING AUTOMOBILES. THE UNIVERSAL DESIGNTOOL I PROPOSE WILL TAKE ADVANTAGE OF COMPUTATIONAL PRECISION AND SPEED TO CREATE AN ARRAY OF HIGH PERFORMING DESIGNS  THEN TAKE ADVANTAGE OF A USER'S HUMAN INTUITION TO JUDGE AND SELECT DESIGNS ACCORDING TO INTUITIVE PROPERTIES THAT THE COMPUTER CANNOT COMPUTE ON ITS OWN (E.G. DESIGNS THAT ARE NOVEL  INTERESTING  ATTRACTIVE  OR PROMISING). THE FACT THAT DIFFERENT PRESSURES ARE SHAPING THE DESIGN FROM DIFFERENT SYSTEMS (THE USER'S PREFERENCES AND THE COMPUTER'S PERFORMANCE METRIC) WILL OVERCOME MANY OF THE PROBLEMS WITH LOCAL OPTIMA AND LACK OF DIVERSITY THAT EAS HAVE FACED IN THE PAST. ADDITIONALLY  RECENT WORK HAS SHOWN THAT THE USE OF DRIVERS SUCH AS INTERESTINGNESS OR NOVELTY CAN BE MORE EFFECTIVE DRIVERS OF EAS THAN A DIRECT PERFORMANCE METRIC. THE ITERATIVE DESIGN PROCESS OF AN EA MEANS THAT THERE IS ALWAYS A FUNCTIONALLY VIABLE  FULLY DESCRIBED  DESIGN THAT IS BEING OPTIMIZED. THUS AT ANY POINT IN TIME  THE BEST CURRENT DESIGN CAN BE SENT TO A 3D PRINTER FOR IMMEDIATE FABRICATION. THIS DESIGN TOOL WOULD CONTAIN PROPERTIES SUCH AS: IMMEDIATE AND INDIVIDUALIZED FABRICATION POTENTIAL OF CURRENT DESIGNS; LACK OF NEED FOR DOMAIN SPECIFIC KNOWLEDGE OR FOR FULL INTUITION OF THE (USUALLY NON-LINEAR) CONSTRAINTS AND PROCESSES OCCURRING (AND BEING OPTIMIZED) AT MULTIPLE SCALES; AND THE SOLE REQUIREMENTS OF A HIGH LEVEL PERFORMANCE METRIC AND GENERAL HUMAN INTUITION. THESE MAKE THIS SYSTEM IDEAL FOR DESIGN OPTIMIZATION AT ANY SCALE-WHETHER IT BE AS LARGE AND RIGOROUS AS A NASA SPACECRAFT OR AS QUICK AND SIMPLE AS A CLEANING ROBOT AT HOME OR A LOAD BEARING FRAME AT AN INDUSTRIAL JOB SITE. ADDITIONALLY  SINCE THE DESIGN PROCESS IS ITERATIVE AND BASED OFF OF RIGOROUS SIMULATION AND VALIDATION FROM A PERFORMANCE MODEL  ALL PRODUCTS THAT COME OUT OF THIS SYSTEM WILL HAVE A DIGITAL TWIN - A SIMULATED VERSION UPON WHICH ADDITIONAL TESTS  CIRCUMSTANCES  OR PROJECT MIRRORING CAN TAKE PLACE.

THIS RESEARCH PROJECT IS TO CONTINUE AND EXTEND THE SCOPE OF THE CURRENT PROJECT  OPTICAL NEURAL SENSING USING A MICRO-SPECTROMETER IN THE RAT BRAIN   NNX12AH22A. THE AIMOF THIS RESEARCH IS TO DEVELOP AN OPTICAL NEURAL SENSING SYSTEM USING NANO-PLASMONIC OPTICAL SENSING PROBES  A MICRO-SPECTROMETER AND MINIATURIZED ELECTRONICS WHICH ARETARGETED FOR IN-VIVO NEURAL SENSING IN ANIMALS. THE LONG TERM GOAL FOR THIS SYSTEM IS TO READ NEURAL ACTIVITY IN REAL TIME AND TO PROVIDE AUTONOMOUS CONTROL THROUGH A CLOSEDLOOP FEEDBACK SYSTEM FOR DEEP BRAIN STIMULATION TREATMENT. THE IMPACT OF THIS TECHNOLOGY WILL SIGNIFICANTLY ENHANCE THE ACCURACY OF DEEP BRAIN STIMULATION TREATMENTFOR PATIENTS WITH NEUROLOGICAL DISEASE AND DISORDERS. USING OPTICAL NEURAL SENSING PRINCIPLES  WE WILL TACKLE THE CURRENT LIMITATIONS OF ELECTRICAL NEURAL SENSING TECHNOLOGIES  SUCH AS NON-SELECTIVE NEUROCHEMICAL SENSING. TOWARD THIS END  THE PLANNED RESEARCH IS TO DEVELOP AN OPTICAL NEUROTRANSMITTER SENSING SYSTEM WHICH ENCOMPASSES TWO NOTICEABLE TECHNOLOGIES: AN OPTICAL SENSING UNIT BASED ON PRINCIPLES OF NANO-PLASMONIC FIELD ENHANCEMENT AND FOCUS ON MINIATURIZATION OF SYSTEM ELECTRONICS FOR SIGNALPROCESSING  CONTROL AND WIRELESS POWER TRANSFER.DETAILS OF PLANS FOR A MINIATURIZED OPTICAL NEURAL SENSING SYSTEM CONSISTS OF FOUR DIFFERENT SUB-PROJECTS ARE BELOW. WE WILL:1) DEVELOP IMPLANTABLE PROBE-PIN DEVICES WHICH CONTACTS WITH NEURAL TISSUE AND TRANSDUCE ELECTRICAL  CHEMICAL  AND MECHANICAL BEHAVIOR RESULTING FROM THE NEURAL ACTIVITY INTO OPTICAL SIGNALS. FOR THIS  WE WILL INVESTIGATE SURFACE ENHANCED RAMAN SPECTROSCOPY (SERS) FOR PROBE DESIGN TO ENHANCE SENSITIVITY AND SELECTIVITY TO NEUROTRANSMITTERS.2) IMPROVE THE DESIGN OF A MINIATURIZED MICRO-SPECTROMETER WITH A FRESNEL LENS AND A CMOS IMAGE SENSOR CONVERTING OPTICAL SPECTRUM INTO ELECTRICAL SIGNALS.3) INTEGRATE ELECTRONIC MODULES SIGNAL PROCESSING  CONTROL  WIRELESS DATA COMMUNICATION  AND WIRELESS POWER TRANSFER UNITS.4) PERFORM ACUTE AND CHRONIC ANIMAL EXPERIMENTS ON LIVING BRAIN TISSUE OR IN THE BRAIN TO VERIFY THE FUNCTION OF NEURAL SENSING UNITS.

RELIABILITY IS THE PROBABILITY THAT A PRODUCT WILL PROPERLY FUNCTION  WITHIN SPECIFIED PERFORMANCE LIMITS  FOR A SPECIFIED PERIOD OF TIME  UNDER THE LIFE CYCLE APPLICATION CONDITIONS. BY WITHIN SPECIFIED PERFORMANCE LIMITS  IT MEANS THAT A PRODUCT MUST FUNCTION IN A MANNER TO MEET THE USER NEEDS IN ORDER TO BE RELIABLE. A SPECIFIED PERIOD OF TIME MEANS THAT A PRODUCT HAS A USEFUL LIFE DURING WHICH IT IS EXPECTED TO PROPERLY FUNCTION. TIME CAN BE TIME  MILES  CYCLES  OR ANY SEQUENCE OR SEQUENCING INDEX. THE RELIABILITY IS TIED WITH THE LIFE CYCLE APPLICATION CONDITIONS AS A PRODUCT S RELIABILITY DEPENDS ON ITS OPERATIONAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL LIFE CYCLE CONDITIONS. RELIABILITY PREDICTION OF ELECTRONICS ARE PERFORMED WITH MANY METHODS   INCLUDING HANDBOOKS  TEST DATA  FIELD DATA  SIMILARITY ANALYSIS  THROUGH PROGNOSTICS  AND THROUGH THE USE OF PHYSICS OF FAILURE (POF) TOOLS. AMONG THE HANDBOOKS  FIDES ALSO CLAIMS TO INCORPORATE POF AND THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO EVALUATE THE HOW COMPATIBLE POF AND FIDES ARE WITH USE OF CASE STUDIES.

LANDING ON MARS REQUIRES DECELERATION AND ADJUSTMENT OF THE LANDER DURING THE DESCENT PHASE USING ROCKET ENGINES. THE IMPINGEMENT OF THE PLUME ON THE LOOSE SOIL SURFACE WILL INDUCE STRONG EROSION AND PRODUCE A LARGE CRATER  WHICH WILL POTENTIALLY DESTABILIZE THE LANDERS. ANOTHER HAZARD CAUSED BY THE PLUME-SOIL INTERACTION IS THE EJECTA POWERED BY THE SUPERSONIC PLUME TRAVELLING AT KILOMETERS PER SECOND  POSING RISKS TO THE DEVICE AND EQUIPMENT ON BOARD. DURING THE INSIGHT MISSION  THE FIRST PHOTO TRANSMITTED BACK TO EARTH IS CLEARLY COVERED WITH MANY BLACK DUST PARTICLES  WHICH ARE PROBABLY EMITTED DURING THE DESCENT PHASE. THIS CLEARLY DEMONSTRATES THE IMPORTANCE OF UNDERSTANDING DUST ENTRAINMENT AND EJECTA DYNAMICS DURING LANDING. HOWEVER  THE DATASET IN THIS AREA IS EXTREMELY LIMITED  PARTLY DUE TO THE UNDERDEVELOPED DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS FOR THIS TYPE OF HIGH-SPEED PARTICLE-LADEN FLOW. TO FILL THIS GAP  WE PROPOSE TO CONSTRUCT AN EXPERIMENTAL FRAMEWORK TO IDENTIFY SOME KEY PHYSICS OF THE PARTICLE DYNAMICS IN A HIGH-SPEED JET. THE GOAL OF THE PROPOSED PROJECT IS TO DEVELOP STATE-OF-THE-ART DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS AND USE THEM TO UNDERSTAND THE PARTICLE DYNAMICS IN A COMPRESSIBLE HIGH-SPEED JET. THE RESULTS WILL HELP TO VALIDATE THE NUMERICAL SIMULATION WHICH IS CURRENTLY DEVELOPED BY ANOTHER TEAM AT NASA JPL AND UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN.

HUMAN?CENTERED CYBERSECURITY RISKS CONSTITUTE A SIGNIFICANT PORTION OF THE HAZARDS FACING ANY MODERN INSTITUTION. RECENT HIGH PROFILE DATA SECURITY BREACHES SUCH AS THE EQUIFAX AND FACEBOOK SCANDALS ARE CURRENTLY HIGHLIGHTING THE NEED FOR A BROAD UNDERSTANDING OF BASIC CYBERSECURITY AMONG BOTH PROFESSIONALS AND THE AVERAGE CITIZEN. MORE LOCALLY  FAIRMONT STATE UNIVERSITY (FSU) HAS EXPERIENCED AN UPTICK IN THE VOLUME OF PHISHING ATTEMPTS AGAINST STUDENTS  FACULTY  AND STAFF IN RECENT MONTHS. THIS PROJECT WILL GIVE FOUR TO SIX TALENTED CYBERSECURITY AND MATHEMATICS STUDENTS AT FSU THE OPPORTUNITY TO ANALYZE SOCIAL ENGINEERING ATTACKS. THE PROJECT WILL UTILIZE STATISTICS AND MACHINE LEARNING TECHNIQUES TO ANALYZE CYBERSECURITY DATA. PENDING FSU INSTITUTIONAL REVIEW BOARD APPROVAL  AN EXPERIMENT WILL ALSO BE CONDUCTED THAT WILL TEST VULNERABILITY TO PHISHING E?MAILS  VULNERABILITY TO USB DROPS  AND THE EFFECTIVENESS OF CERTAIN KINDS OF TRAINING ON PREVENTING FURTHER POTENTIAL SECURITY BREACHES. PHISHING AND OTHER TYPES OF SOCIAL ENGINEERING ARE A COMMON WAY THAT MALICIOUS ENTITIES OBTAIN PRIVATE INFORMATION. A USB?DROP EXPERIMENT WAS CONDUCTED AT UNIVERSITY OF ILLINOIS AT URBANA?CHAMPAIGN ([TISCHER 2016] [TISCHER 2017]) WHERE USB DRIVES WERE DISTRIBUTED ON A UNIVERSITY CAMPUS WHICH CONTAINED FILES THAT CONNECTED TO AN EXTERNAL WEBSITE RUN BY THE RESEARCHERS TO COLLECT DATA. BY CONNECTING TO THE WEBSITE  INFORMATION ABOUT THE BROWSER AND HARDWARE OF THE INDIVIDUAL WAS AUTOMATICALLY COLLECTED. THE WEBSITE ALSO DIRECTED THE PERSON WHO OPENED THE FILE TO A VOLUNTARY SURVEY FOR MORE PERSONAL INFORMATION. THEIR RESULTS SUGGEST THAT PEOPLE ON A UNIVERSITY CAMPUS WILL NOT ONLY PLUG IN FOREIGN USB DRIVES  BUT THEY WILL ALSO ACTUALLY OPEN FILES ON THEM AT A HIGH RATE. THE EFFECTIVENESS OF PHISHING TRAINING IS A HEAVILY STUDIED TOPIC. THERE ARE MANY STUDIES THAT EXAMINE TRAINING TO COUNTERACT PHISHING ([MAYHORN 2010]  [SIADATII 2017]  [KUMARAGURU 2010]). TRAINING CAN COME IN MANY TYPES  E.G. SECURITY TRAINING MEETINGS  TRAINING EMBEDDED INTO FAKE PHISHING E?MAILS THEMSELVES  TRAINING VIA GAMES  AND ROUTINE REPORTS SENT THAT DESCRIBE RECENT PHISHING E?MAIL ATTEMPTS. FOR AN INSTITUTION LIKE FSU  THE DAMAGE THAT CAN BE DONE BY THESE THREATS IS LIMITED LARGELY TO THE PERSONAL DATA OF EMPLOYEES AND STUDENTS. THESE ISSUES ARE HEIGHTENED FOR A FEDERAL AGENCY LIKE NASA WHICH HAS NATIONAL SECURITY INTERESTS TO CONSIDER. MOREOVER  SINCE THERE IS AN INTERSECTION OF PERSONNEL BETWEEN FSU AND NASA IV&V  THE RESULTS OF AN EXPERIMENT ON FSU CAMPUS IS NATURALLY INTERESTING TO BOTH INSTITUTIONS.

CHANGES OF CLOUD COVER AND RADIATIVE PROPERTIES OF ANTARCTIC CLOUDS CAN HAVE RIPPLE EFFECTS FOR THE GENERAL CIRCULATION OF THE ATMOSPHERE AND CAN CAUSE NOT YET THOROUGHLY UNDERSTOOD FEEDBACKS TO THE CLIMATE SYSTEM  E.G.  IN ENHANCING MELTING EVENTS. THE US DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY DEPLOYMENT AT THE MCMURDO SITE ON THE SOUTHERN TIP OF ANTARCTICA S ROSS ICE SHELF DURING THE ATMOSPHERIC RADIATION MEASUREMENTS (ARM) WEST ANTARCTIC RADIATION EXPERIMENT (AWARE) FIELD CAMPAIGN OF AN UNPRECEDENTED NUMBER OF MULTI-WAVELENGTH ACTIVE AND PASSIVE REMOTE SENSING SYSTEMS OFFERS THE UNIQUE OPPORTUNITY OF OVERCOMING THE SCARCITY OF CLOUD INFORMATION AT SOUTHERN HIGH LATITUDES AND OF UNRAVELLING STRUCTURES AND PROCESSES RELATED TO CLOUD AND PRECIPITATION PHYSICS AT HIGH TEMPORAL AND SPATIAL RESOLUTION. THIS PROJECT CONSISTS OF ANALYSIS AND APPLICATION OF DATA GATHERED DURING AWARE TO ACHIEVE THREE LINKED OBSERVATIONAL AND MODELING SCIENCE OBJECTIVES. (1) BY APPLYING A MODULAR OPTIMAL ESTIMATION (OE) ALGORITHM TO A COMBINATION OF LIDAR  TRIPLE-FREQUENCY RADAR AND MICROWAVE RADIOMETER MEASUREMENTS FROM THE MCMURDO AWARE SITE WE WILL PRODUCE A SEAMLESS CLOUD PROPERTY CHARACTERIZATION FROM THE THINNEST SUPERCOOLED LIQUID OR ICE LAYERS TO THE THICKEST PRECIPITATING ICE. (2) WE WILL FOR THE FIRST TIME ADD TO THE OE ALGORITHM OUTPUTS AN IDENTIFICATION OF ACTIVE ICE PHYSICAL PROCESSES (VAPOR GROWTH/SUBLIMATION  AGGREGATION  RIMING  ICE MULTIPLICATION) WITHIN THE SAME CLOUD MASK BY FULLY EXPLOITING MULTI-FREQUENCY DOPPLER SPECTRA. (3)WE WILL MAKE SYNERGISTIC USE OF THESE OBSERVATIONAL PRODUCTS TO EVALUATE AND IMPROVE NASA'S MODELE GENERAL CIRCULATION MODEL (GCM).

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CONTINUE DEVELOPING  EVALUATING  AND TRANSFERRING STATE-OF-THE-ART SOFTWARE ENGINEERING TECHNOLOGIES AND SOFTWARE ASSURANCE METHODS IN SUPPORT OF NASA S OFFICE OF SAFETY AND MISSION ASSURANCE (OSMA) AND TO CONTINUALLY IMPROVE THE SOFTWARE ASSURANCE CAPABILITIES FOR NASA MISSIONS. AS MANY INNOVATIVE SOFTWARE ENGINEERING TECHNOLOGIES EMERGE  NASA S INTEREST IN ADOPTING THEM FOR MISSIONS INCREASES IN CORRESPONDENCE. ADDITIONALLY  NEW FOCUS AREAS SUCH AS CYBERSECURITY  AUTONOMY  AND ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE HAVE BECOME MORE RELEVANT FOR NASA MISSIONS. CONSEQUENTLY  THIS REQUIRES SOFTWARE ASSURANCE ENGINEERS (SAE) TO ADAPT AND DEVELOP SOFTWARE ASSURANCE METHODS THAT ARE CAPABLE OF SUPPORTING  EVALUATING  AND ASSURING NASA PROJECTS WITH CONFIDENCE.

WE SEEK TO ASSIST NASA GODDARD SPACE FLIGHT CENTER (GSFC) IN PERFORMING STRAY LIGHT TESTING OF A NEW COMPACT CORONAGRAPH DESIGN WHICH IS PROPOSED TO MAKE A 1 DAY BALLOON FLIGHT TO MEASURE THE ELECTRON BULK FLOW SPEED AND TEMPERATURE OF THE SOLAR K-CORONA AND TO DETERMINE IF STREAMER BLOBS IN THE CORONA ARE TRACERS OF THE SOLAR WIND. LOW STRAY LIGHT PERFORMANCE IS NEEDED TO ACQUIRE GOOD SIGNAL-TO-NOISE OF THE K-CORONA AND TO MINIMIZE SCATTERED LIGHT AROUND THE OCCULTER THAT CAN OBSCURE THE INNER CORONA SIGNAL. THE PROPOSED WORK WILL HELP ASSESS THE DESIGN OF A NEW SPACE-BASED SOLAR INSTRUMENTATION AND WILL HELP ACHIEVE THE SCIENCE GOALS THAT ARE DIRECTLY RELEVANT TO NSF SPACE WEATHER PROGRAM  NASA HELIOPHYSICS TECHNOLOGY AND INSTRUMENT DEVELOPMENT AND THE NASA LIVING WITH A STAR SCIENCE AND SPACE WEATHER GOALS.

THE RECENT ICE GIANTS PRE-DECADAL SURVEY MISSION REPO1T  2017 (IGPDS) [I] RECOMMENDED THE SCIENTIFIC IMPORTANCE AND HIGH PRIORITY OF SENDING A MISSION WITH AN ORBITER AND A PROBE TO ONE OF THE ICE GIANTS WITH PREFERENTIAL LAUNCH DATES IN THE 2029-2034 TIMEFRAME. SUCH A MISSION WILL ADVANCE OUR UNDERSTANDING OF THE SOLAR SYSTEM  EXOPLANETARY SYSTEMS  PLANETARY FORMATION  AND EVOLUTION. THE IGPDS REPORT IDENTIFIED TWELVE SCIENCE OBJECTIVES FOR ICE GIANT EXPLORATION THAT ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE VISION AND VOYAGES PLANETARY SCIENCE DECADAL SURVEY (NRC 2011; HEREAFTER REFERRED TO AS V&V) [2]. HIGHLIGHTED IN THE REPORT ARE TWO SCIENCE OBJECTIVES  OF EQUAL IMPORTANCE  THAT RELATE TO THE ATMOSPHERIC (THERMAL) STRNCTURE OF THESE ICY WORLDS: (I) DETERMINE THE PLANET'S ATMOSPHERIC HEAT BALANCE AND (II) DETERMINE THE PLANET'S TROPOSPHERIC 3-D FLOW. KEY QUESTIONS CONCERNING THE ATMOSPHERIC STRUCTURE ARISE: WHAT ARE THE ALTITUDES/PRESSURES AND COMPOSITIONS OF THE CLOUD LAYERS? HOW DO THE CLOUD LAYERS INTERACT WITH SOLAR VISIBLE AND PLANETARY THERMAL RADIATION TO INFLUENCE THE ATMOSPHERIC ENERGY BALANCE? HOW DOES THE ENERGY BALANCE CONTRIBUTE TO ATMOSPHERIC DYNAMICS? OUR UNIQUE NET FLUX RADIOMETER (NFR) CONCEPT  FIG. L  ONBOARD A PROBE DESCENDING DEEP INTO THE ATMOSPHERE WILL CONTRIBUTE GREATLY TO ANSWERING THESE QUESTIONS BY MEASURING THE UPWARD AND DOWNWARD RADIATION FLUX  IN SEVEN SPECTRAL CHANNELS  EACH WITH A 5  FIELD-OF-VIEW (FOY) AND IN FIVE SEQUENTIAL VIEW (SKY) ANGLES AS A FUNCTION OF ALTITUDE/PRESSURE.

WVSGC HOUSED AT WEST VIRGINIA UNIVERSITY WVU  AND THE NASA IV&V PROGRAM HAS BEEN IN EFFECT SINCE AUGUST 1  2012. HOWEVER THIS AGREEMENT IS DUE TO EXPIRE ON SEPTEMBER 30 2018  AND  HENCE  THE NEED TO SUBMIT A NEW PROPOSAL AND WORK AGREEMENT THAT WOULD REFLECT THE CURRENT RESEARCH AND OUTREACH PRIORITIES OF THE IV&V PROGRAMAND WVSGC. COMPONENTS OF THIS PROPOSAL ARE DESIGNED TO SUPPORT RESEARCH AND ENHANCE HIGH-TECH WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT IN LINE WITH THE MISSION OF BOTH ENTITIES. INITIATED BY NASA IN 1989  THE NATIONAL SPACE GRANT COLLEGE AND FELLOWSHIP PROGRAM  ALSO KNOWN AS SPACE GRANT IS A NATIONAL NETWORK OF COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES. THESE INSTITUTIONS ARE WORKING TO EXPAND OPPORTUNITIES FOR AMERICANS TO UNDERSTAND AND PARTICIPATE IN NASA'S AERONAUTICS AND SPACE PROJECTS BY SUPPORTING AND ENHANCING SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING EDUCATION  RESEARCH  AND WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT. THE SPACE GRANT NATIONAL NETWORK INCLUDES OVER 850 AFFILIATES FROM UNIVERSITIES  COLLEGES  INDUSTRY  MUSEUMS  SCIENCE CENTERS  AND STATE AND LOCAL AGENCIES WHICH FUND FELLOWSHIPS AND SCHOLARSHIPS FOR STUDENTS PURSUING CAREERS IN SCIENCE  TECHNOLOGY  ENGINEERING  AND MATHEMATICS  OR STEM  AS WELL AS CURRICULUM ENHANCEMENT AND FACULTY DEVELOPMENT. THE NASA WEST VIRGINIA SPACE GRANT CONSORTIUM WAS ESTABLISHED IN AUGUST 1991 AND IS A GROUP OF WEST VIRGINIA ACADEMIC INSTITUTIONS WITH INDUSTRIAL PARTNERS THAT HAVE JOINED TOGETHER UNDER THE SPONSORSHIP OF NASA. THE WVSGC INCLUDES EIGHT WEST VIRGINIA UNIVERSITIES AND FOUR WEST VIRGINIA COLLEGES AS WELL AS THE COMMUNITY AND TECHNICAL COLLEGE SYSTEM OF WEST VIRGINIA. WEST VIRGINIA UNIVERSITY  FOUNDED IN 1867  IS THE LEAD INSTITUTION. THE CONSORTIUM IS HOUSED IN THE STATLER COLLEGE OF ENGINEERING AND MINERAL RESOURCES ON THE EVANSDALE CAMPUS OF WVU. THE NASA IV&V PROGRAM WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1993 AS PART OF AN AGENCY-WIDE STRATEGY TO PROVIDE THE HIGHEST ACHIEVABLE LEVELS OF SAFETY AND COST-EFFECTIVENESS FOR MISSION-CRITICAL SOFTWARE. THE NASA IV&V PROGRAM WAS FOUNDED UNDER THE NASA OFFICE OF SAFETY AND MISSION ASSURANCE OSMA AS A DIRECT RESULT OF RECOMMENDATIONS MADE BY THE NATIONAL RESEARCH COUNCIL NRC AND THE REPORT OF THE PRESIDENTIAL COMMISSION ON THE SPACE SHUTTLE CHALLENGER ACCIDENT. THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THE AGENCY IV&V PROGRAM IS TO REDUCE THE INHERENT RISK IN THE AGENCY S ABILITY TO PROCURE  DEVELOP  DEPLOY  AND OPERATE SOFTWARE WITHIN THE DESIRED COST  SCHEDULE AND PERFORMANCE GOALS. THE IV&V PROGRAM IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE MANAGEMENT OF ALL SOFTWARE IV&V EFFORTS WITHIN THE AGENCY. IT IS THE NASA IV&V PROGRAM S RESPONSIBILITY TO PROVIDE VALUE-ADDED ASSURANCE SERVICES TO AGENCY SAFETY AND MISSION-CRITICAL SOFTWARE BASED ON THE COST  SIZE  COMPLEXITY  LIFESPAN  RISK  AND CONSEQUENCES OF FAILURE. THE NASA IV&V PROGRAM IS MADE UP OF THE IV&V OFFICE VVO  THE IVV SMA SUPPORT OFFICE ISSO  THE STRATEGIC COMMUNICATIONS OFFICE SCO  AND THE PROGRAM SUPPORT OFFICE PSO. THE IV&V PROGRAM IS ALSO HOST TO OSMA S SOFTWARE ASSURANCE RESEARCH PROGRAM SARP. IN SUPPORT OF ITS PRIMARY OBJECTIVE  NASA IV&V PROGRAM IS ALSO RESPONSIBLE FOR SUPPORTING AND CONTRIBUTING TO AGENCY-LEVEL ACTIVITIES THAT IMPROVE SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT AND SOFTWARE ASSURANCEPRODUCTS AND PRACTICES FOR THE AGENCY. THESE INCLUDE PERFORMING INDEPENDENT ASSESSMENTS/EVALUATIONS OF SOFTWARE PROCESSES AND PRODUCTS THROUGHOUT A PROJECT S DEVELOPMENT LIFECYCLE  PEER REVIEWS  AND OTHER ACTIVITIES AS DIRECTED BY OSMA. FURTHERMORE  NASA IV&V SEEKS TO CONDUCT RESEARCH ASSOCIATED WITH ADVANCING THE STATE OF PRACTICE FOR IV&V. NASA IV&V MAINTAINS SUPPORT ACTIVITIES THAT CONTRIBUTE TO THE MANAGEMENT AND INSTITUTIONAL EXCELLENCE. THESE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE EFFORTS ASSOCIATED WITH INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY  OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE AND KNOWLEDGE MANAGEMENT. NASA IV&V ALSO PERFORMS EDUCATION AND OUTREACH BY ACTIVELY PARTICIPATING IN THE VITALITY OF THE COMMUNITY AND ENGAGING THE PUBLIC IN THE EXPERIENCE AND BENEFITS OF EXPLORATION AND DISCOVERY  NASA  AND THE IV&V PROGRAM. THIS PROPOSAL OUTLINES A PLAN FOR THE CONTINUED COLLABORATIVE RELATIONSHIP VIA A GRANT BETWEEN NASA S INDEPENDENT VERIFICATION AND VALIDATION (IV&V) PROGRAM AND FAIRMONT STATE UNIVERSITY (FSU) IN SUPPORT OF EXTENDING THE EXISTENCE OF THE EDUCATOR RESOURCE CENTER  KNOWN HENCEFORTH  AS THE EDUCATION RESOURCE CENTER (ERC). THE WORK OF THE ERC BRINGS LIFE TO THE VISION AND MISSION OF NASA IV&V BY EXPANDING OPPORTUNITIES FOR WEST VIRGINIA S STUDENTS AND EDUCATORS WHO ARE DEDICATED TO THE PROMOTION OF SCIENCE  TECHNOLOGY  ENGINEERING AND MATHEMATICS (STEM) EDUCATION. ADDITIONALLY  THE COLLABORATION WILL OFFER EDUCATORS ACCESS TO FACILITIES AND SUPPORTED APPLICATION OF EXPERTISE IN THEIR EFFORTS TO MEET NATIONAL AND STATE STEM EDUCATION STANDARDS.

WE WILL USE AN NKT PHOTONICS SUPERK COMPACT SCL FOR THE EMITTER. WE WILL USE AN ENGINEERING MODEL OF NIRSPEC  THE NEAR-INFRARED SPECTROMETER DEVELOPED BY DR. COLAPRETE AT AMES AND PROPOSED FOR THE MARS 2020 MISSION. THE SPECTROMETER WILL BE COUPLED TO A 3-INCH TELESCOPE  ALSO DEVELOPED FOR THE SPECTROMETER. THE LASER BEAM WILL ILLUMINATE THE TARGET OBSERVED BY THE SPECTROMETER.  THREE DIFFERENT SAMPLE MATERIALS WILL BE TESTED: 1) LUNAR SIMULANT  2) H2O ICE  AND 3) CO2 ICE.  THE TARGET TO INSTRUMENT DISTANCE WILL BE CAREFULLY CONTROLLED  AND MEASUREMENTS WILL BE TAKEN AT 1-M  5-M AND 10-M. THE EXPERIMENT WILL BE PERFORMED ON AN OPTICAL BENCH  USING MIRRORS TO CREATE THE DISTANCE. A SMALL 5 MW MONOCHROMATIC LASER (ALSO CO-ALIGNED WITH THE TELESCOPE) WILL BE USED FOR TARGETING TO ENSURE SAFETY. THE SYSTEM WILL BE HOUSED IN A LIGHTPROOF ENCLOSURE AND OPERATED IN A LASER-CERTIFIED LAB.  S/N MEASUREMENTS WILL BE OBTAINED DIRECTLY FROM THE SPECTRA  AND THE DETECTABILITY OF DIAGNOSTIC ABSORPTION FEATURES AS A FUNCTION OF DISTANCE WILL BE QUANTIFIED FOR EACH MATERIAL.

THE OVERARCHING GOALS OF THIS COLLABORATIVE PROGRAM ARE: 1. TO CHARACTERIZE AND MODEL QUANTITATIVELY METEOR MEASUREMENTS  WITH A FOCUS ON ESTABLISHING BIASES AND THEREFORE DEFINE THE "TRUE" METEOROID ENVIRONMENT 2. ESTABLISH ESTIMATES OF UNCERTAINTIES FOR MEASURED QUANTITIES RELATED TO THE METEOROID ENVIRONMENT 3. PROVIDE OPERATIONAL SITUATIONAL AWARENESS OF THE METEOROID ENVIRONMENT.

APPLYING ITS UNIQUE EXPERTISE AND EXPERIENCE AS THE DEVELOPERS OF BOTH THE WIDELY USED LIGHTNING MAPPING ARRAY (LMA) AND A NEW  INNOVATIVE BROADBAND VERY HIGH FREQUENCY (VHF) LIGHTNING INTERFEROMETER (INTF)  LMA TECHNOLOGIES LLC WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT OF NASA AND NOAA PROGRAMS CONCERNED WITH LIGHTNING STUDIES. BOTH OF THESE LIGHTNING OBSERVING SYSTEMS PROVIDE STATE-OF-THE-ART 2-D AND 3-D OBSERVATIONS OF THE STRUCTURE AND TEMPORAL DEVELOPMENT OF COMPLETE LIGHTNING FLASHES INSIDE THUNDERSTORMS. THE OBSERVATIONS CAN BE USED AS A PROXY FOR LIGHTNING DISCHARGES TO BE DETECTED OPTICALLY BY THE GLOBAL LIGHTNING MAPPER (GLM) ON BOARD THE UPCOMING GOES-R SATELLITE. THE INTF MEASUREMENTS IN PARTICULAR ARE OBTAINED WITH MICROSECOND TO SUB-MICROSECOND TIME RESOLUTION  AND INCLUDE SIMILAR HIGH TIME-RESOLUTION SFERICS OBSERVATIONS INDICATIVE OF OPTICALLY BRIGHT CURRENT EVENTS.

THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROPOSAL IS TO DEVELOP AN ANMBR SUITABLE FOR ZERO-G SETTINGS. THE MAJOR BARRIER IN THE TRANSITION OF THE ANMBR FROM GRAVITY-BASED GROUND SYSTEM TO CLOSED-SYSTEM ZERO- G SYSTEM IS RELATED TO THE REDESIGN OF 1) BIOREACTOR GEOMETRY AND 2) SOLID/LIQUID/GAS SEPARATION MECHANISMS FACILITATED BY ULTRAFILTRATION (SEPARATION OF GAS/LIQUID FROM SOLID) AND GAS-PERMEABLE (SEPARATION OF GAS FROM LIQUID) MEMBRANES. THE BIOREACTOR GEOMETRY WILL NEED TO ACCOMMODATE THE REDISTRIBUTION OF POSITIVE DENSITY GRADIENTS FROM TOP TO BOTTOM (EARTH-BASED SYSTEMS) TO CENTER TO PERIMETER (ZERO G). ACCORDINGLY  THE MEMBRANE SEPARATION SYSTEMS WILL NEED REDESIGN/REALIGNMENT THROUGH THE COMBINED USE OF TUBULAR AND HOLLOW FIBER FORM FACTORS.

THE NATIONAL OCEANIC AND ATMOSPHERIC ADMINISTRATION (NOAA) / NATIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL SATELLITE  DATA  AND INFORMATION SERVICE (NESDIS) OPERATES A GEOSTATIONARY OPERATIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL SATELLITE (GOES) CONSTELLATION THAT SERVES AS THE REAL-TIME MONITOR OF HIGH IMPACT ENVIRONMENTAL PHENOMENA ACROSS THE WESTERN HEMISPHERE. FOR MORE THAN 40 YEARS THE GOES SYSTEM HAS ENABLED FORECASTERS TO PROVIDE CRITICAL LIFE-SAVING INFORMATION TO THE PUBLIC. THE NEWLY DEVELOPED GOES-R SERIES OF FOUR SATELLITES FOR THE FIRST TIME CARRIES A GEOSTATIONARY LIGHTNING MAPPER (GLM)  UNIQUE IN ITS CAPABILITY TO PROVIDE REAL-TIME LIGHTNING DETECTION AND MAPPING OF HIGH IMPACT WEATHER INCLUDING SEVERE STORMS AND HURRICANES  AND NON-WEATHER PHENOMENA SUCH AS FIRES AND METEORITES. WITH THE LAUNCH OF THE FIRST TWO SATELLITES IN THE SERIES  GOES-16  NOW THE OPERATIONAL GOES-EAST LOCATED OVER THE ATLANTIC OCEAN BASIN WITH A VIEW OF THE AMERICAS  AND GOES-17  PLANNED TO BECOME THE OPERATIONAL GOES-WEST OVER THE PACIFIC OCEAN BASIN IN NOVEMBER  2018  THERE IS MUCH ATTENTION TO THE CALIBRATION  VALIDATION  AND SCIENTIFIC EXPLOITATION OF THESE NEW INSTRUMENTS AND THEIR PRODUCTS  AND A CONCERTED EFFORT TO MAKE USERS READY TO MAKE THE BEST USE OF THE DATA THROUGH GOES-R PROGRAM OUTREACH  TRAINING  AND EDUCATION AT NATIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCES AND WORKSHOPS  AND THROUGH DEMONSTRATIONS IN THE GOES-R PROVING GROUND AT THE NOAA TESTBEDS. THE GOES-R INSTRUMENTS ARE UNDERGOING VALIDATION THROUGH CONCURRENT MEASUREMENTS FROM OTHER WELL CALIBRATED GROUND-BASED INSTRUMENTS AND NETWORKS  INSTRUMENTED AIRPLANES  AND WELL CHARACTERIZED OPERATIONAL AND RESEARCH SATELLITE MISSIONS. FOR GLM  THE LIGHTNING DATA SETS ARE USED ALONE AND IN CONJUNCTION WITH OTHER MEASUREMENTS THAT CHARACTERIZE CLOUD AND PRECIPITATION PROCESSES (E.G.  NASA S GLOBAL PRECIPITATION MISSION  GPM)  AND HIGH IMPACT ENVIRONMENTAL PHENOMENA (E.G.  SEVERE STORMS  HURRICANES  FIRES). THE CALIBRATION WORKING GROUP (CWG) AND ALGORITHM WORKING GROUP (AWG) TEAMS CONDUCT VIGOROUS CALIBRATION/VALIDATION ON THE INSTRUMENTS INCLUDING PARTICIPATION IN NATIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL FIELD CAMPAIGNS  AND THROUGH INTERNATIONAL COOPERATION WITH THE WORLD METEOROLOGICAL ORGANIZATION (WMO) MEMBERS  SPACE AGENCIES  AND NATIONAL METEOROLOGICAL AND HYDROLOGICAL SERVICES (E.G.  EUMETSAT  INPE  JMA  CMA  ECCC). RESEARCH ON LIGHTNING DETECTION FROM SPACE HAS BEEN CONDUCTED AND NUMEROUS PAPERS PUBLISHED IN THE PEER REVIEWED LITERATURE SINCE THE EARLY 1980S.

MANY FUTURE NASA MISSIONS WILL REQUIRE THE COORDINATION OF MULTIPLE SPACECRAFT TO ACHIEVE THEIR OBJECTIVES. TO DATE  SUCH MISSIONS HAVE RELIED ON A HIGH DEGREE OF CENTRALIZED PLANNING  CONTROL  AND COMMUNICATION. THIS APPROACH HAS RESULTED IN NOTABLE SUCCESSES  INCLUDING FORMATION FLYING MISSIONS LIKE GRACE AND GRAIL AND CONSTELLATIONS LIKE THE GLOBAL POSITIONING SYSTEM (GPS). HOWEVER  SCALING UP TO LARGER NUMBERS OF INDIVIDUAL SPACECRAFT POSES NEW CHALLENGES. LOW-COST SMALL SATELLITES HAVE MADE IT POSSIBLE TO DEPLOY TENS OR EVEN HUNDREDS OF INDIVIDUAL SPACECRAFT FROM A SINGLE LAUNCH VEHICLE. OUT OF NECESSITY  COMMERCIAL SATELLITE OPERATORS ARE ALREADY DEVELOPING NEW METHODS FOR NAVIGATING  CONTROLLING  AND COMMUNICATING WITH SMALL SATELLITES IN LEO THAT SCALE TO HUNDREDS OF SPACECRAFT. HOWEVER  THESE APPROACHES STILL MAKE HEAVY USE OF GROUND-BASED INFRASTRUCTURE AND CENTRALIZED PLANNING AND CONTROL PERFORMED FROM THE GROUND.

THE PROPOSED PROJECT FOCUSES ON BRINGING TOGETHER DATA COLLECTED AT NATIONAL AND REGIONAL SCALES  E.G. REMOTE SENSING DATA SETS  FIELD OBSERVATIONS AND REPORTS; CROSS CHECKING THE CROP ASSESSMENTS PRODUCED BY THE DIFFERENT ORGANIZATIONS; REACHING CONSENSUS ON A BASELINE SUITE OF CROP ASSESSMENTS: AND PRODUCING MONTHLY CROP CONDITION BULLETINS THAT SUMMARIZE THE STATUS OF CROPS IN COUNTRIES OF THE DEVELOPING WORLD. MAPS HIGHLIGHTING DISAGREEMENTS BETWEEN AGENCIES IS ALSO BE PRODUCED AS A BASIS FOR DISCUSSION AMONGST THE PARTICIPATING AGENCIES.

THE 2015 NASA TECHNOLOGY ROADMAP DEFINES THE CRITICAL NEED FOR A WATER PURIFICATION SYSTEM WITHIN TA 6.1.2. THE CURRENT AND PROPOSED SYSTEMS FOR WATER PURIFICATION ARE NOT CLOSED-LOOP AND REQUIRE MULTIPLE CONSUMABLES TO MAINTAIN THE SYSTEMS. IN ADDITION  TA 6.1.3 DEFINES THE NEED FOR A WASTE MANAGEMENT SYSTEM ABOVE JETTISONING WASTE OUTSIDE THE CAPSULE. HEREIN OUR PROPOSED SYSTEM SOLVED BOTH OF THESE CRITICAL NEEDS IN ONE BY COMBINING THE WASTE SYSTEM WITH WATER PURIFICATION. WE PLAN TO WORK WITH AES AND SLPS TO EXPLORE FUTURE FUNDING AND FLIGHT POTENTIALS. THE TEAM PLANS TO PURSUE A NASA USIP GRANT IN 2018-19 TO FLY THE PROTOTYPE SYSTEM ABOARD THE ZEROG PLANE.

PROPOSED MISSIONS SUCH AS A MARS SAMPLE RETURN MISSION AND A HUMAN MISSION TO MARS REQUIRE LANDED PAYLOAD MASSES MORE THAN ANY PREVIOUS MARS MISSION. WHETHER HUMAN OR ROBOTIC  THESE MISSIONS PRESENT NUMEROUS ENGINEERING CHALLENGES IN ENTRY  DESCENT  AND LANDING (EDL) OPERATIONS DUE TO THEIR INCREASED MASS AND COMPLEXITY. TO OVERCOME THESE CHALLENGES  NEW TECHNOLOGIES MUST BE DEVELOPED  AND EXISTING TECHNOLOGIES ADVANCED. RESOURCE UTILIZATION TECHNOLOGIES ARE PARTICULARLY CRITICAL IN THIS EFFORT. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS INVESTIGATION IS TO STUDY THE RECLAMATION AND HARNESSING OF VEHICLE KINETIC ENERGY THROUGH MAGNETOHYDRODYNAMIC (MHD) INTERACTION WITH THE HIGH-TEMPERATURE ENTRY PLASMA FOR PURPOSES OF ENERGY GENERATION AND LIFT-DRAG MODULATION. POTENTIAL MISSION DESIGNS  POWER GENERATION AND POWER STORAGE CONFIGURATIONS WILL BE EXPLORED  AS WELL AS USES FOR THE RECLAIMED ENERGY. FURTHERMORE  THE IMPACT AND UTILITY OF MHD FLOW INTERACTION FOR VEHICLE CONTROL WILL BE ASSESSED. THE STATE-OF-THE-ART FOR ANALYSIS OF MHD EQUIPPED PLANETARY ENTRY SYSTEMS WILL BE ADVANCED  WITH THE SPECIFIC GOALS INCLUDING: DEVELOPMENT OF PERFORMANCE ANALYSIS CAPABILITIES FOR POTENTIAL MHD EQUIPPED SYSTEMS  IDENTIFICATION OF SYSTEMS OR CONFIGURATIONS THAT SHOW PROMISE AS EFFECTIVE USES OF MHD POWER GENERATION  EXPERIMENTAL DESIGNS FOR DEVELOPING TECHNOLOGIES APPLICABLE TO MHD POWER GENERATION SYSTEMS  ASSESSMENT OF MHD FLOW INTERACTION AND BENEFICIAL USE FOR ENTRY VEHICLE CONTROL THROUGH LIFT-DRAG MODULATION  AND INCREASING THE TECHNOLOGY READINESS LEVEL OF MHD POWER GENERATION ARCHITECTURES FOR ENTRY  DESCENT AND LANDING. THESE OBJECTIVES WILL BE ADVANCED THROUGH COMPLETION OF THE FOLLOWING AIMS: I.) MHD ENERGY GENERATION AND LORENTZ FORCE LIFT-DRAG AUGMENTATION PERFORMANCE CHARACTERIZATION  II.) EXPERIMENTAL DEMONSTRATION OF MHD ENERGY GENERATION IN CONDITIONS AND CONFIGURATIONS RELEVANT TO PLANETARY ENTRY  AND III.) IMPACT OF MHD ENERGY GENERATION AND LORENTZ FORCE LIFT-DRAG AUGMENTATION ON PLANETARY ENTRY.

CR ME IS A SOFTWARE SUITE THAT USES MODELS OF RADIATION ENVIRONMENTS COUPLED WITH RESPONSE MODELS OF MICROELECTRONIC PARTS TO ESTIMATE THE FREQUENCY THAT PARTS WILL LOSE INFORMATION (KNOWN AS ERROR RATES) IN SPACE SYSTEMS. VANDERBILT UNIVERSITY/ISDE MAINTAINS THE CODE AND OPERATION OF THE WEB-BASED ACCESS  ENSURING TRUST AS WELL AS CONTINUING ACCESS. R-GENTIC IS A GUIDE FOR RADIATION EFFECTS APPROPRIATE FOR DEVELOPERS OF SMALL MISSIONS WITH LITTLE TO NO EXPERTISE. THE TOOL HELPS IDENTIFY WHICH ELECTRONIC PARTS AND EFFECTS RADIATION HARDNESS ASSURANCE ACTIVITIES SHOULD FOCUS ON. HIGHLY INTEGRATED ELECTRONICS COMPLICATE CLASSICAL SEE RELIABILITY ANALYSIS. MTTF METHODS DEVELOPED FOR FPGA ANALYSIS NEED TO BE EVALUATED FOR APPLICATION TO COMPLEX MICROELECTRONICS BROADLY.

OUR PROPOSED APPROACH IS TO EXAMINE THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN MISSION COMPLEXITY  DEVELOPMENT SCHEDULE AND MISSION SUCCESS. SPECIFICALLY  WE BELIEVE THAT WE CAN FIND A CORRELATION BETWEEN THE TIMING OF DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES (E.G.  PROGRAM KICKOFF  LAUNCH MANIFEST  CDR  ENGINEERING UNIT  FINAL INTEGRATION  TESTING AND DELIVERY)  THE COMPLEXITY OF THE MISSION  AND THE ON-ORBIT SUCCESS. WE EXPECT TO FIND SIGNIFICANTLY HIGHER RATES OF FAILURE AMONG PROGRAMS THAT HAD TO TRUNCATE THEIR TESTING IN ORDER TO MEET THE FIXED LAUNCH DATE. WE BELIEVE THAT THIS INFORMATION WILL HELP US SET UP GUIDELINES TO HELP PROGRAMS SCOPE MISSION COMPLEXITY AGAINST SCHEDULE AND THEIR OWN PROGRAM S CAPABILITIES. WE ATTEMPTED TO COMPLETE THIS TASK DURING THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE OF THE LAST GRANT. HOWEVER  SIMPLY KEEPING UP WITH THE DATABASE PROVED TO BE MORE THAN ENOUGH WORK GIVEN THE SCOPE OF SUPPORT. WE PROPOSE A NEW APPROACH: SITE VISITS AND/OR INTERVIEWS WITH AT LEAST EIGHT OF THE MOST PROLIFIC DEVELOPERS OF CUBESATS AMONG THE CONSTELLATION  CRAFTER AND INDUSTRIAL CATEGORIES. IF WE ARE ABLE TO LEARN ABOUT THEIR APPROACH TO RISK  MISSION ASSURANCE PRACTICES  PRE-FLIGHT TESTING  ETC.  WE CAN START ATTACHING REAL INFORMATION TO OUR INFORMED SPECULATION. SHOULD FUNDING BECOME AVAILABLE  WE WILL PURSUE A SECOND MAJOR RESEARCH THRUST. IN THE SAME WAY THAT VANDERBILT UNIVERSITY HAS LEVERAGED THE SYSML SPECIFICATION AND THEIR OWN CAPABILITIES TO DEFINE A MODEL-BASED APPROACH TO IDENTIFYING RADIATION-EFFECTS RISKS IN CUBESATS  WE BELIEVE THAT THIS APPROACH CAN BE EXPANDED TO COVER ISSUES OF MISSION DESIGN  INTEGRATION AND VERIFICATION (I.E.  CUBESAT MISSION SUCCESS (2018) 3 SLU:SWARTWOUT THE RISK FACTORS WE THINK ARE THREATENING MANY CUBESAT MISSIONS  BEFORE THE RADIATION EFFECTS HAVE THE CHANCE).

BUILDING AN AUTONOMOUS ARCHITECTURE THAT USES DIRECTED SELF-LEARNING NEURO-FUZZY NETWORKS WITH THE AIM OF DEVELOPING AN INTELLIGENT AUTONOMOUS COLLISION AVOIDANCE DECISIONMAKING PROCESS; INCLUDING GROUND AND SPACE BASED SENSOR TASKING AND DATA TRANSFER FOR ONBOARD AUTONOMOUS MANEUVER DECISION. OUR IDEA IS TO CONSTRUCT A NOVEL NEURO-FUZZY LOGIC DECISION MAKING (NEODEM) SYSTEM THAT IS BASED ON ADDITIONAL INFORMATIONAL PARAMETERS  INTELLIGENTLY CHOSEN USING SUPERVISED MACHINE LEARNING  BEYOND THE COLLISION PROBABILITY VALUES ALONE. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR ROBUST AUTONOMOUS DECISION MAKING INVOLVING THE IMPROVEMENT OF THE INITIAL UNCERTAINTIES  KNOWLEDGE OF INFORMATION QUALITY AND DECISION FIDELITY THAT WILL PROVIDE POTENTIAL COST SAVINGS FOR SENSOR OPERATIONS  REDUCE FALSE ALARM MANEUVERS AND IMPROVED ASSET PROTECTION.

THE CORE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DEVELOP TECHNIQUES TO USE AVAILABLE ARCHITECTURE INFORMATION TO IDENTIFY AND EVALUATE RISK. A LONGER-TERM FOLLOW-ON OBJECTIVE IS TO EXPLOIT THE ARCHITECTURE DERIVED RISKS TO DEVELOP HIGH-VALUE ASSURANCE OBJECTIVES THAT WOULD NOT BE READILY IDENTIFIABLE TO AN EXPERIENCED SUBJECT MATTER EXPERT.

A MISSION CONCEPT BEING DEVELOPED FOR NASA ENTAILS STUDY OF HEAT  MOISTURE AND ENERGY GENERATION WITHIN THE MONSOON AND THEIR TRANSPORT TO REGIONS OUTSIDE THE MONSOON REGIONS  SUCH AS THE ARCTIC ICE MELT  AND THE GENESIS REGIONS FOR TROPICAL STORMS/HURRICANES OF THE EASTERN ATLANTIC. A MASSIVE MONSOONAL OUTFLOW FROM THE UPPER TROPOSPHERIC FEATURE CALLED THE TIBETAN HIGH PLAYS A KEY ROLE IN TRANSFERRING LARGE AMOUNTS OF HEAT  MOISTURE AND ENERGY ALONG A WESTERLY SUBTROPICAL JET STREAM NORTH OF THE HIMALAYAS  AND ALONG A TROPICAL EASTERLY JET FROM THE ARABIAN SEA TO THE EASTERN ATLANTIC. MISSION CONCEPT DESIGN AND FLIGHT PLANNING TO STUDY THESE IMPACTS OF THE MONSOON CALLS FOR CHARACTERIZING THE OCCURRENCE FREQUENCY AND CLIMATOLOGY OF THESE JETS USING METEOROLOGICAL REANALYSIS DATA SETS AND STATISTICAL ALGORITHMS. THE QUESTIONS TO BE INVESTIGATED BY THE ASIAN MONSOON MISSION (MONREACH) ARE: 1. WHAT ARE THE FACTORS CONTROLLING THE DYNAMICS AND PHYSICS OF NORTHWARD MARCH OF MONSOON ACROSS SOUTH ASIA? 2. WHAT IS THE EFFICIENCY OF THE VERTICAL TRANSPORTS  AS SEEN FROM THE "ISOCHRONES" OF RAIN AND MOISTURE AT ITS FORWARD EDGE  IN REGARD TO ITS PROGRESSION? 3. HOW DOES STRONGER DIVERGENT WIND OVER THE ARABIAN SEA BETWEEN 400 AND 200 HPA FAVORS MORE AND STRONGER CONVECTION  AND CONVERSELY  MORE AND STRONG CONVECTIVE EVENTS ENHANCE DIVERGENT WIND? 4. HOW DOES THE AEROSOL LOADING INFLUENCE THE EASTERLY WIND ANOMALY FROM THE BAY OF BENGAL ALL THE WAY TO THE ARABIAN SEA? IS THERE ANY EFFECTIVE SHIFT OF THE WESTERLY SOMALI JET LEADING TO THE SLOWER PROGRESSION OF THE MONSOON DUE TO HEAVY AEROSOL LOADING? 5. HOW DOES THE SIZE OF ORGANIZED CONVECTION FAVOR EVAPORATIVE COOLING AND SIZE OF COLD POOLS AND SYSTEM AND SYSTEM-WIDE UPDRAFT MASS FLUX AND CONVERSELY  HOW DOES MORE EVAPORATIVE COOLING AND STRONGER COLD POOLS FAVOR LARGER MORE ORGANIZED CONVECTIVE SYSTEMS? 6. HOW DOES THE AMOUNT OF AEROSOLS IN THE ENVIRONMENT OF STORMS INFLUENCE EVAPORATION-PRONE HYDROMETEORS  THEREBY INFLUENCING THE COLD POOL AND ITS FURTHER EFFECT ON THE ORGANIZATION OF CONVECTION ALONG THE ISOCHRONE? 7. HOW DOES THE RATE OF PROGRESSION MODULATE THE TRANSPORT OF HEAT AND ENERGY UP TO THE UTLS THROUGH THE UPPER-LEVEL DIVERGENCE ACROSS THE ISOCHRONE? 8. HOW IS THE EXCESS HEAT OF THE SOUTH ASIAN MONSOON CONVEYED TO THE ARCTIC VIA WAVE TRAINS ALONG CERTAIN PATHWAYS? (WE ARE RELYING ON THE FACT THAT EXTREME EVENTS CAN BE FORECAST WITH ABOUT 48 HOURS LEAD TIME.) 9. HOW DOES THE DIFFLUENCE OF THE MONSOONAL TROPICAL EASTERLY JET (TEJ) AT THE 200HPA CONTRIBUTE TO THE INTENSIFICATION OF AFRICAN DISTURBANCES INTO CATEGORY 4 AND 5 HURRICANES? 10. HOW STATISTICALLY SIGNIFICANT ARE THE NUMBERS OF TROPICAL STORMS GENERATING OUT OF THE COAST OFF AFRICA INTENSIFYING INTO HURRICANES LINKED TO THE PASSAGE OF AFRICAN EASTERLY WAVES WITH A DIFFLUENCE PATTERN OF THE TEJ ALOFT? IN ORDER TO ANSWER THESE QUESTIONS  AN AIRCRAFT MISSION DESIGN IS BEING CREATED TO SAMPLE PROFILES OF WIND  WATER VAPOR AND RAINFALL. THE OCCURRENCE FREQUENCY OF THE EASTERLY TROPICAL JET AND OTHER MONSOON-RELATED FEATURES TO BE SAMPLED USING MISSION AIRCRAFT WILL BE CHARACTERIZED USING STATISTICS FROM METEOROLOGICAL REANALYSIS DATA. THIS ANALYSIS WILL ALSO BE USED TO CREATE SPECIFIC FLIGHT PLANS TO BE USED DURING THE MONREACH MISSION.

THE NASA ACADEMY OF AEROSPACE QUALITY (AAQ) (HTTP://AAQ.AUBUM.EDU) SERVES AS AN INTERNET BASED FORUM FOR PROVIDING QUALITY ASSURANCE TRAINING TO ACADEMICS INVOLVED IN AEROSPACE RESEARCH  TECHNOLOGY DEVELOPMENT  AND PAYLOAD DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT. THE NASA AAQ CURRICULUM INCLUDES SOME 50 MODULES FOR ALL ASPECTS OF QUALITY ASSURANCE NECESSARY TO ENSURE PROJECT SUCCESS AND PROVIDES A VIRTUAL AND REAL COMMUNITY FOR NETWORKING AND SHARING OF LESSONS-LEARNED AMONG LIKE-MINDED SCHOLARS. CURRENT YEAR PRIMARY OBJECTIVES ARE (1) TO FINISH DEVELOPMENT OF THE USER CERTIFICATION OF COMPLETION SYSTEM  TRIAL THIS SYSTEM AND THEN FULLY IMPLEMENT IT AND (2) CONTINUE MODULE DEVELOPMENT AND REFINEMENT.

IMPLEMENTED IN THE SFRAT TO THE ONE BILLION DOLLAR SPACEFENCE PROGRAM TO ENSURE THAT THE GOVERNMENT RECEIVES QUALITY SOFTWARE FOR THE TAXPAYER DOLLARS SPENT. IN ADDITION TO THE SFRAT TOOL  WE HAVE ALSO IMPLEMENTED A NEXT GENERATION SWEEP TOOL [4]  WHICH CAN BE USED PRIOR TO WORKING CODE BECAUSE IT ACCEPTS INPUTS SUCH AS SOFTWARE CHANGE REQUESTS IN PLACE OF SOFTWARE FAILURE DATA COLLECTED DURING UNIT AND INTEGRATION TESTING. THUS  OUR NEXT GENERATION TOOLS SUPPORTS THE STAGES IMMEDIATELY FOLLOWING NEUFELDER S MODELS [5] AND PROVIDE MORE SOFTWARE RELIABILITY GROWTH MODELS AND INFERENCES FOR LATER STAGES OF TESTING AS WELL AS PRACTICAL APPLICATIONS  INCLUDING OPTIMAL RELEASE TRADEOFFS BETWEEN COST AND RELIABILITY THAT DRIVE SAFETY.

CLOUDFLARE IS DEDICATED TO HELPING TO IMPROVE THE REDUNDANCY  RESPONSIVENESS  AND SECURITY OF THE BROADER DNS INFRASTRUCTURE OF THE GLOBAL INTERNET AND WOULD LIKE TO EXTEND ITS PERFORMANCE AND SECURITY OFFERINGS TO NASA S E-ROOT EXISTING OPERATIONS. CLOUDFLARE IS PROPOSING TO ADD IT S DNS INFRASTRUCTURE TO E-ROOT S FOOTPRINT AND ANYCAST DNS SERVICE. CLOUDFLARE  IN ITS DAY-TO-DAY OPERATIONS  PROVIDES AUTHORITATIVE DNS SERVICE TO MILLIONS OF DOMAINS AND ONE ROOT LETTER. BECAUSE CLOUDFLARE CARES ABOUT THE SPEED AND RESPONSIVENESS OF THE GLOBAL INTERNET  IT'S COMMITTED TO ANSWER CUSTOMER DNS QUERIES AS FAST AS POSSIBLE. WITH A ROOT DNS INFRASTRUCTURE HOSTED ON CLOUDFLARE S NETWORK  CLOUDFLARE CAN SHAVE SIGNIFICANT MILLISECONDS FOR EACH DNS QUERY IT'S ASKED  MAKING THE INTERNET FASTER FOR EVERY END-USER. AS OF MARCH 2017  CLOUDFLARE STARTED PROVIDING DNS SERVICE TO ONE OF THE THIRTEEN ROOT OPERATORS. WHEN THAT ROOT OPERATOR ENABLED THEIR LETTER VIA CLOUDFLARE SERVICE  THEIR AVERAGE RESPONSE TIME DROPPED GLOBALLY FROM 8MS ON IPV4 TO 5MS AND FROM 13MS ON IPV6 TO 7MS  MAKING THEM ONE OF THE TWO FASTEST ROOT LETTERS. CLOUDFLARE PROVIDES THIS SERVICE UNDER CONTRACT TO THE ROOT OPERATOR(S); CLOUDFLARE IS NOT A ROOT OPERATOR AND ISN T INTENDING TO BE CLASSIFIED AS ONE. THE CLOUDFLARE DNS INFRASTRUCTURE SPECIALIZES IN HANDLING LARGE-SCALE DDOS ATTACKS  SO IT CAN ENSURE THE RELIABILITY OF THE ROOT ZONE CONTENTS EVEN DURING A MASSIVE INBOUND PACKET FLOOD. THIS GLOBAL PLATFORM OPERATES USING A LONG-STANDING  TRIED-AND-TESTED  CUSTOM DNS SERVER WRITTEN IN THE GO LANGUAGE  HENCE BRINGING MORE SOFTWARE DIVERSITY TO THE DNS ROOT ZONE OPERATIONAL ARENA. NO OTHER PROVIDER HAS THE SECURITY  DEEP-DEPLOYMENT  OR BANDWIDTH OF DNS INFRASTRUCTURE DEPLOYED GLOBALLY FOR THIS PURPOSE. CLOUDFLARE BRINGS A COLLECTION OF MORE CPU CORES  MORE BANDWIDTH  MORE EXPERTISE  AND MORE LOCATIONS THAN ANY OTHER PROVIDER TO THE ROOT ZONE OPERATORS.

THIS AGREEMENT BETWEEN PCH AND NASA ARC WILL ENABLE PCH TO DISTRIBUTE E.ROOT-SERVERS.NET DOMAIN NAME SERVICES TO OTHER GEOGRAPHIC LOCATIONS TO PROVIDE BETTER REDUNDANCY  AND RESILIENCE TO INTERNET USERS WITHOUT ADDITIONAL COST TO NASA. NASA WILL CONTINUE TO MAINTAIN THE CORE FUNCTION OF THE SERVICE UTILIZING ONLY NASA RESOURCES. THIS AGREEMENT ENABLES NASA TO PROVIDE A MORE ROBUST VERSION OF E.ROOT IN A COST NEUTRAL WAY  BY LEVERAGING A RELATIONSHIP WITH A NON-PROFIT ENTITY  PCH  WHOSE MISSION IS TO PROVIDE MORE ROBUST DNS PERFORMANCE IN THIRD WORLD COUNTRIES.

THE NASA/HSS FELLOWSHIPS IN AEROSPACE HISTORY ARE INTENDED TO SUPPORT SCHOLARLY RESEARCH PROJECTS IN AEROSPACE HISTORY. THESE ANNUAL FELLOWSHIPS GRANT THE OPPORTUNITY TO ENGAGE IN SIGNIFICANT AND SUSTAINED ADVANCED RESEARCH IN ALL ASPECTS OF THE HISTORY OF AEROSPACE FROM THE EARLIEST HUMAN INTEREST IN FLIGHT TO THE PRESENT  INCLUDING CULTURAL AND INTELLECTUAL HISTORY  ECONOMIC HISTORY  HISTORY OF LAW AND PUBLIC POLICY  AND THE HISTORY OF SCIENCE  ENGINEERING  AND MANAGEMENT. AMONG THE RESOURCES AVAILABLE TO HISTORIANS OF SPACE  MANY ARE AT THE NASA ARCHIVES. THESE INCLUDE MATERIALS RELATED TO THE INTERNATIONAL GEOPHYSICAL YEAR AND NASA MISSIONS  AS WELL AS TO THE HISTORY OF THE INSTITUTION ITSELF. FELLOWS WILL BE ENCOURAGED TO TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THESE RESOURCES AT NASA ARCHIVES AS WELL AS AT THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES  THE NATIONAL ACADEMIES OF SCIENCE  THE LIBRARY OF CONGRESS  THE SMITHSONIAN AIR AND SPACE MUSEUM  AND OTHER COLLECTIONS IN THE WASHINGTON  DC  AREA. ADDITIONALLY  FELLOWS WILL BE EXPECTED TO WRITE A REPORT AND PRESENT A PUBLIC LECTURE ON THE FELLOWSHIP EXPERIENCE. NASA S HISTORY OFFICE IS DEDICATED TO DOCUMENTING AND PRESERVING THE AGENCY S HISTORY. THE RESEARCH RESULTING FROM THE NASA/HSS AEROSPACE HISTORY FELLOWSHIPS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE TWO KEY FUNCTIONS OF THE NASA HISTORY OFFICE: WIDELY DISSEMINATING AEROSPACE INFORMATION AND HELPING NASA MANAGERS TO UNDERSTAND AND LEARN FROM PAST SUCCESSES AND FAILURES.

WE WILL DEVELOP AN INITIAL CAPABILITY THAT WILL ALLOW DYNAMIC OPTIMIZATION BETWEEN MISSION PERFORMANCE AND ACOUSTIC SIGNATURE FOR A REPRESENTATIVE TILT-WING VTOL VEHICLE WITH DISTRIBUTED ELECTRIC PROPULSION WHILE INCORPORATING COLLISION AVOIDANCE ALGORITHMS THAT RETAIN ORIGINAL MISSION OBJECTIVES. WE WILL CONSIDER OFF-NOMINAL CONDITIONS THAT INCLUDE PROPULSION FAILURES  MOVING OBSTACLES AND SEVERE GUSTS. WE WILL ALSO INCORPORATE UNCERTAINTIES ASSOCIATED WITH DETECTION OF OBSTACLES  ACOUSTIC SIGNATURE  AND PROPULSIVE EFFICIENCY. TWO TYPES OF OPTIMIZATION FRAMEWORKS WILL BE EXPLORED. THE FIRST ONE WILL BE FORMULATED IN THE SPIRIT OF NON-ZERO SUM GAME  WHERE THE INTEREST IN THE TWO OBJECTIVES WILL NOT BE IN CONFLICT  E.G. MAINTAIN CERTAIN ACOUSTIC SIGNATURE AND TO GET TO A DESTINATION WITHIN A LARGE TIME WINDOW. THE SECOND FORMULATION WILL BE FORMULATED WITHIN THE SPIRIT OF ZERO-SUM GAME  E.G. MINIMIZE ACOUSTIC SIGNATURE AND MINIMIZE TIME TO DESTINATION. IN CASE OF PROPULSIVE FAILURE  BECAUSE THERE IS REDUNDANCY OF PROPULSION DEVICES  IT MIGHT STILL BE POSSIBLE TO OPTIMIZE BETWEEN MINIMUM ACOUSTIC SIGNATURE AND SAFE AIRCRAFT FLIGHT WITH SLIGHTLY DEGRADED PERFORMANCE.

AS WE CONTINUE TO EXPAND OUR PRESENCE IN THE SOLAR SYSTEM TO MARS AND BEYOND  DEVELOPING INTELLIGENT  AUTONOMOUS TECHNOLOGIES FOR SUSTAINABLE HABITATS IS NEEDED IN ORDER TO PROLONG HUMAN PRESENCE IN DEEP SPACE. THIS IS PARTICULARLY THE CASE WHEN SIGNIFICANT TIME DELAYS (BETWEEN HABITAT AND EARTH) AND UNCERTAINTY NECESSITATE SOLUTIONS THAT ARE ABLE TO ADAPT AND LEARN IN A CHANGING ENVIRONMENT. THE ROLE OF AUTONOMY CONSTITUTES A CRITICAL COMPONENT IN THIS DIRECTION. AIDED BY THE RECENT MINIATURIZATION OF LOWCOST  DISTRIBUTED SENSING (INTERNET OF THINGS (IOT)) AND REAL-TIME COMPUTATION A NUMBER OF NOVEL ARCHITECTURES THAT HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO IMPROVE AUTONOMY IN COMPLEX SYSTEMS CAN BE TESTING AND VALIDATED. THIS PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON THE DEVELOPMENT OF REAL-TIME MONITORING  DIAGNOSTICS  AND INTELLIGENT CONTROL METHODS THAT COME TOGETHER TO IMPROVE OPERATIONAL EFFICIENCY  INCREASE AUTONOMY  AND ENHANCE GLOBAL PERFORMANCE OBJECTIVES. BOTH HUMAN--AUTONOMY INTERACTION AND CYBERSECURITY IN AUTONOMOUS SYSTEMS CONSTITUTE AN IMPORTANT COMPONENT OF THE MAIN OBJECTIVES AND MAY BE EXPLORED. RESEARCH WILL BE CONDUCTED IN SEVERAL BUILDINGS IN THE NASA AMES RESEARCH PARK INCLUDING NASA AMES SUSTAINABILITY BASE.

FUTURE SPACE MISSIONS ARE EXPECTED TO TAKE US OVER LARGE DISTANCES FROM EARTH THEREBY INDUCING INSIGNIFICANT LIGHT-TIME DELAYS. THE COMPLEX INTERPLAY BETWEEN AUTONOMY AND ONBOARD DECISION SUPPORT SYSTEMS INTRODUCE NEW VULNERABILITIES THAT ARE EXTREMELY HARD TO PREDICT WITH EXISTING MISSION ANALYSIS TOOLS. RESILIENCE IS THE ABILITY TO ANTICIPATE ADVERSE PERFORMANCE CONDITIONS  AND TO GRACEFULLY ADAPT TO SUCH CONDITIONS. SENSING  ANTICIPATION  ADAPTATION  AND LEARNING PROCESSES CAN BE GENERALLY VIEWED TO CHARACTERIZE RESILIENCE AS AN OVERARCHING SYSTEM-LEVEL PROPERTY. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THE PROPOSED RESEARCH WOULD BE DEVELOPMENT OF SUITABLE MATHEMATICAL MEASURES AND METRICS THAT QUANTIFY THE DEGREE OF RESILIENCE OF A SPACE SYSTEM (SELF-AWARENESS) WITH RESPECT TO BASELINE MISSION CONOPS AND HAZARD MITIGATION ANALYSIS. THESE MEASURES WILL BE SOUGHT TO BE GENERAL ENOUGH TO SUPPORT A BROAD CLASS OF DISTRIBUTED SPACECRAFT MISSIONS  BUT STILL BE PRECISE ENOUGH TO PERMIT THE SHARP QUANTIFICATION OF SYSTEM-SPECIFIC ATTRIBUTES. OUR APPROACH SIGNIFICANTLY CONTRASTS WITH TRADITIONAL UNCERTAINTY MANAGEMENT  AND FAULT DETECTION/ISOLATION APPROACHES THAT TEND TO PROVIDE CONSERVATIVE METRICS BY TYPICALLY ASSESSING RISKS ONLY TO INDIVIDUAL COMPONENTS  THEREBY IGNORING THE SYSTEM-WIDE COUPLING EFFECTS/SYNERGIES. RATHER THAN ADOPTING SUCH A "STATIC" VIEW OF INTERCONNECTED SYSTEMS FOR RISK ASSESSMENT  OUR PROPOSED SELFASSESSMENT ALGORITHMS FOR RESILIENCE QUANTIFICATION TAKES A "DYNAMIC" VIEW THAT ENCOMPASSES ANTICIPATION  ADAPTATION  AND ONBOARD LEARNING FUNCTIONALITIES. THE RESULTS OF THIS PROPOSED RESEARCH ARE EXPECTED TO PROVIDE BOTH ALGORITHMS AND SOFTWARE THAT DELIVER AUTONOMY SOLUTIONS FOR SPACE SYSTEMS WITH ASSURED LEVELS OF PERFORMANCE  RELIABILITY  AND RESILIENCE  WHILE ACCOMMODATING DYNAMIC UNCERTAINTIES  OFF-NOMINAL PERFORMANCES  HIGH-VOLUME DATA RATES  AND LOW-BANDWIDTH COMMUNICATION NETWORKS.

THIS PROPOSAL AIMS TO EVALUATE THE IMPACT OF SPACE BIOMEDICAL RESEARCH ON OPERATIONAL SPACE MEDICINE AS IT RELATES TO NASA HEADQUARTERS POLICY AND OVERSIGHT RESPONSIBILITIES. TO ACHIEVE THIS GOAL  THE CENTER FOR SPACE MEDICINE AT BAYLOR COLLEGE OF MEDICINE WILL ASSIGN AN OUTSTANDING PHYSICIAN-SCIENTIST WITH DOMAIN EXPERTISE TO THE NASA HEADQUARTERS OFFICES OF THE HUMAN EXPLORATION AND OPERATIONS MISSION DIRECTORATE AND THE CHIEF HEALTH AND MEDICAL OFFICER. AN ONGOING REVIEW AND EVALUATION OF DESIGNED METRICS WILL BE PERFORMED FOCUSING ON RESEARCH MERIT AND RELEVANCE  USE OF HUMAN SUBJECTS  THE TRANSITION OF RESEARCH DELIVERABLES TO MEDICAL PRACTICE  AND OUTCOMES INFORMING MEDICAL STANDARDS  REQUIREMENTS AND IMPROVEMENTS. THE RESULTS WILL BE USED TO REFINE RESEARCH ACTIVITIES AND OPERATIONAL MEDICINE NEEDS FOR EXPLORATION MISSIONS.

THE IARPA QUANTUM ENHANCED OPTIMIZATION (QEO) PROGRAM REQUIRES COST-EFFECTIVE  STATE-OF-ART  OBJECTIVE  AND PROGRAMMATICALLY FLEXIBLE TEST AND EVALUATION (T&E) CAPABILITIES TO VALIDATE THAT PERFORMER RESULTS ARE PRECISE AND ACCURATE AS REPORTED  RELATIVE TO THE PROGRAM GOALS. TO THIS END  TEXAS A&M UNIVERSITY (TAMU) IS UNIQUELY SUITED TO WORK AS NASA'S SUBCONTRACTOR FOR THE T&E EFFORT. IN PARTICULAR  TAMU AND NASA HAVE SHARED AND UNIQUE CAPABILITIES  AS WELL AS VALIDATION ROLES AND OBJECTIVES. THESE INCLUDE EXPERTISE IN ERROR MODELS  THE EFFECTS OF NOISE ON CLASSICAL BENCHMARKS  ENHANCEMENT MODELS  PROJECTIONS  AND CORROBORATION OF RESULTS  PRECISION REQUIREMENTS VS MIS-SPECIFICATION  AS WELL AS QUANTUM ADVANTAGE VIA TAILORED PROBLEMS BASED ON SPIN GLASSES  CSPS  AND CURRENT APPLICATIONS OF INTEREST TO IARPA. TAMU PROVIDES IARPA THROUGH NASA A HIGHLY-RESPONSIVE AND AUTHORITATIVE MEANS TO QUANTIFY THE DEEPEST SIGNIFICANCE OF PERFORMER RESULTS RELATIVE TO QEO GOALS  AND THEIR BROADER SIGNIFICANCE TO THE COMMUNITY AND FUTURE IARPA INTERESTS.

IN ORDER TO HELP ENSURE THE SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THE SCIENTIFIC EFFORT OUTLINED IN THIS PROPOSAL  USU (RYAN DAVIDSON) HAS AGREED TO WORK TOWARDS UPGRADING THE GRIDS ELECTRONICS SO THAT THE SENSOR CAN SUPPORT A HIGH-SPEED MODE CAPABLE OF 10 MEASUREMENTS PER SECOND. THIS GOAL NECESSITATES DESIGN WORK TO BE ACCOMPLISHED AT USU BY DR. DAVIDSON WITH THE HELP OF A GRADUATE RESEARCH ASSISTANT.

THE INTRODUCTION OF COTS PARTS (AND EVEN SUB-SYSTEMS) IS INEVITABLE FOR SPACE SYSTEMS TO MEET THE PERFORMANCE GOAL FOR THE SYSTEMS AND FOR ABILITY TO MANUFACTURE AND SUPPORT THE SYSTEMS IN AN ECONOMIC MANNER. CONVINCING OURSELVES (AND THE CUSTOMERS AND REGULATORS) THAT THESE PARTS CAN MEET THE SYSTEM RELIABILITY GOALS IS A DIFFERENT MATTER ALTOGETHER. THERE HAD BEEN AN IMPLICIT  ALBEIT OFTEN MISPLACED  ASSUMPTION THAT THE MILITARY OR SPACE GRADE PARTS WOULD BE RELIABLE IN SPACE APPLICATIONS  BUT THERE IS NO DIRECT WAY TO EXTEND THAT ASSUMPTION TO THE COTS PARTS. THIS SITUATION IS CREATING AN OBSTACLE TOWARDS THE ADAPTATION OF COTS PARTS INTO CURRENT SPACE SYSTEM DESIGNS. THIS NEED FOR ADAPTATION TO COTS COMPONENTS IS DUE TO THE REDUCTION IN PRODUCTION OF MILITARY OR SPACE GRADE COMPONENTS. MILITARY RATED COMPONENTS MADE UP 2% OF ELECTRONIC COMPONENT INDUSTRY IN 2010 AND EVEN LESS NOW. THE BENEFIT OF MILITARY RATED COMPONENTS WAS THAT THEY PROVIDED MORE DETAILED INFORMATION FOR DESIGN AND ANALYSIS. ADDITIONALLY  THE RISE OF CONSUMER ELECTRONICS HAS RESULTED IN SHORTER COMPONENT LIFETIMES AND LENGTH OF AVAILABILITY. MILITARY AND SPACE APPLICATIONS REQUIRE LONGER SYSTEM LIFETIMES THAN CONSUMER SYSTEMS  FORCING MORE CAREFUL ANALYSIS BEFORE COTS PARTS CAN BE USED TO SUITABLY REPLACE THE MILITARY GRADE EQUIVALENT.

TO DEVELOP A WEB-BASED USER INTERFACE AND DATA ACCESS TO THE AVAILABLE DATA PRODUCTS FOR DATA DOWNLOAD  AND PREPARE FOR DATA ARCHIVING AT NASA'S SPACE PHYSICS DATA FACILITY (SPDF) BEFORE THE COMPLETION OF THIS PROPOSED EFFORT   TO MAXIMIZE THE SCIENCE RETURNS FROM THE VAN ALLEN PROBES AND OTHER PARTICIPATING NASA MISSIONS  AND AUGMENT THE GOLONO INSTRUMENTS' SCIENCE UTILITY AND DATA SERVICE BY WORKING CLOSELY WITH THE VAN ALLEN PROBES MISSION SCIENTIST AND SCIENCE TEAM MEMBERS AND COLLABORATORS FROM THE SCIENCE COMMUNITY TO IDENTIFY ADDITIONAL OBSERVING OPPORTUNITIES   TO PARTICIPATE IN NASA MISSION COORDINATED SCIENCE CAMPAIGNS AND PROVIDE THE GROUND-BASED OBSERVATIONS IN IN SUPPORT OF OTHER NASA MISSIONS

THE ACTIVITIES PROPOSED IN THIS EFFORT ARE TO COMPLETE THE CHARACTERIZATION OF DEBRIS FRAGMENTS RESULTING FROM THE DEBRISAT AND DEBRISLV HYPERVELOCITY IMPACT (HVI) EXPERIMENTS CONDUCTED IN 2014. IN AN EFFORT TO MINIMIZE DAMAGE TO THE GENERATED DEBRIS FRAGMENTS DURING THESE HVI EXPERIMENTS  A SOFT-CATCH ARENA WAS UTILIZED BETWEEN THE TEST ARTICLES AND THE WALLS OF THE TEST CHAMBER. THE SOFT-CATCH ARENAS WERE IDENTICAL FOR BOTH HVI EXPERIMENTS AND CONSISTED OF LAYERS OF LOW  MEDIUM  AND HIGH DENSITY FOAM PANELS ARRANGED RADIALLY ALONG THE TEST CHAMBER WALLS AS WELL AS UPSTREAM AND DOWNSTREAM OF THE TEST ARTICLE. POST-HVI EXPERIMENTS  ALL DEBRIS WITHIN THE TEST CHAMBER WERE CAREFULLY COLLECTED AND SHIPPED TO THE UNIVERSITY OF FLORIDA FOR PROCESSING AND FRAGMENT CHARACTERIZATION. PROCESSING INVOLVES THE COLLECTION AND CATALOGING OF ALL LOOSE AND EMBEDDED FRAGMENTS WITH AT LEAST ONE LINER DIMENSION 2 MM AND LARGER. CHARACTERIZATION INVOLVES THE DETERMINATION OF EACH FRAGMENT S MASS  SIZE (CHARACTERISTIC LENGTH  AVERAGE CROSS-SECTIONAL AREA  VOLUME)  SHAPE  MATERIAL CONTENT  COLOR  AND ASSOCIATED METADATA (E.G.  MULTIPLE IMAGES OF THE FRAGMENT  FOAM PANEL FROM WHICH THE FRAGMENT WAS RETRIEVED  ETC.). TO ENSURE THE INTEGRITY OF THE GENERATED DATASET (E.G.  MINIMIZE VARIANCES DUE TO OPERATORS) AND DUE TO THE LARGE NUMBER OF FRAGMENTS TO BE CHARACTERIZED  AUTOMATED AND BATCH-PROCESSING APPROACHES WILL BE IMPLEMENTED. IN ADDITION  PROCESSES FOR CONTINUED IMPROVEMENTS IN EFFICIENCY WILL BE DEVELOPED  TESTED  AND IMPLEMENTED.

PROJECT SUMMARY:  NESS WILL IMPLEMENT CROSS-DISCIPLINARY PARTNERSHIPS TO ADVANCE SCIENTIFIC DISCOVERY AND HUMAN EXPLORATION OF TARGET DESTINATIONS  AND WILL CONDUCT RESEARCH IN ASTROPHYSICS AND HELIOPHYSICS THAT IS UNIQUELY ENABLED BY HUMAN AND ROBOTIC EXPLORATION OF TARGET BODIES.   OUR RESEARCH IS DERIVED FROM THREE DECADAL SURVEYS AND FROM THE NASA ASTROPHYSICS AND GLOBAL EXPLORATION ROADMAPS.  NESS RESEARCH INCLUDES: TELEROBOTIC OPERATION OF SURFACE SCIENCE  EXPLORATION ASSETS AT THE MOON AND MARS  THE NATURE OF THE MOON'S CORE  AN IMPROVED SELENODETIC COORDINATE SYSTEM PRECISION TESTS OF GRAVITATION  ENERGETIC SOLAR PARTICLE EVENTS IN INTERPLANETARY SPACE AND EXTRASOLAR SYSTEMS  DUST ENVIRONMENTS OF SPACE AND TARGET BODIES  DETECTION OF THE UNIVERSE'S FIRST GALAXIES  AND HABITABLE EXOPLANETS.  FOUR KEY PROJECTS WILL BE PROPOSED.    EXPLORATION SCIENCE  NESS WILL MATURE A CRITICAL TECHNOLOGY OF SCIENCE AND EXPLORATION MISSIONS FROM THE ORBITS OF TARGET BODIES:  SURFACE TELEROBOTICS.  WE WILL DEVELOP HUMAN-ROBOTIC SCIENCE ASSOCIATED WITH ORION/HABITAT MISSIONS IN CIS-LUNAR ORBITS.  OUR TEAM WILL BUILD TOOLS FOR THE CREW TO TELEOPERATE ROVERS ON THE LUNAR FARSIDE THAT WILL FEED-FORWARD TO THE FIRST CREWED MARS MISSIONS.  WE WILL INVESTIGATE THE SYSTEMS NEEDED ON ORION/HABITAT TO SUPPORT TELEROBOTICS  ANALYZE LUNAR LOW FREQUENCY RADIO TELESCOPE DEPLOYMENT ALONG WITH A LUNAR SAMPLE RETURN  AND DEVELOP CREW TRAINING STRATEGIES.  LLR  CURRENT ALTERNATE THEORIES OF GRAVITY PREDICT DEVIATIONS FROM GENERAL RELATIVITY  GR  AT A LEVEL THAT IS WITHIN THE GRASP OF THE NEXT GENERATION OF LUNAR LASER RANGING  LLR  INSTRUMENTS.  NESS WILL IMPROVE BY FACTORS GREATER THAN 100 THE SIGNAL PHOTOELECTRON ACCURACY OF LLR TO SET NEW CONSTRAINTS ON GR AND THE LUNAR CORE.  WE WILL ALSO MEASURE/MODEL DUST ON LLR OPTICAL SURFACES AND SIGNIFICANTLY IMPROVE THE SELENODETIC COORDINATE SYSTEM FOR EXPLORATION AND SCIENCE MISSIONS.  HELIOPHYSICS AND SPACE PHYSICS_NESS HELIOPHYSICS RESEARCH DIRECTLY IMPACTS HUMAN EXPLORATION VIA OUR STUDIES OF SOLAR PARTICLE RADIATION AND INTERPLANETARY DUST.  WE WILL ADVANCE THE DESIGN FOR A LUNAR-BASED LOW FREQUENCY  LESS THAN 10 MHZ  RADIO IMAGER  UNIQUELY CAPABLE OF IMAGING THE TRAJECTORY OF PARTICLE ACCELERATION IN SOLAR ERUPTIONS  AND MEASURING INTERPLANETARY NANODUST.  FROM COSMIC DAWN TO HABITABLE PLANETS  NESS ADDRESSES KEY QUESTIONS FROM THE ASTROPHYSICS DECADAL SURVEY: "WHEN AND HOW DID THE FIRST GALAXIES FORM?" AND "CAN WE FIND ANOTHER PLANET LIKE EARTH ORBITING A NEARBY STAR?" OUR TEAM WILL USE NEW MODELING TOOLS AND TECHNOLOGIES TO INVESTIGATE THE FORMATION OF THE FIRST GALAXIES USING THE NEUTRAL HYDROGEN 21-CM SIGNAL  RED-SHIFTED TO 2-3 M.  THE MOON'S FARSIDE IS UNIQUELY SHIELDED FROM RADIO FREQUENCY INTERFERENCE AND FREE FROM IONOSPHERIC EFFECTS TO ENABLE SUCH OBSERVATIONS.  A FARSIDE OBSERVATORY IS IMPORTANT FOR EXPLORATION TO INVESTIGATE THE ENVIRONMENTAL AND TECHNICAL CHALLENGES TO DEPLOYING/OPERATING A LARGE-AREA SCIENTIFIC STATION ON THE MOON.  WE WILL ADVANCE 21-CM COSMOLOGY THEORY  THE DESIGN OF A LOW RADIO FREQUENCY ARRAY  WIDE-BAND RECEIVERS  AND NEW CALIBRATION TECHNIQUES.  NESS ALSO WILL ADVANCE THE STUDY OF THE CHARACTERISTICS OF THE HABITABLE EXOPLANETS BY EMPLOYING POLARIMETRY ON LARGE UV_OPTICAL TELESCOPES CONSTRUCTED IN CIS-LUNAR SPACE  AND BY USING A FARSIDE RADIO ARRAY TO DETECT MAGNETOSPHERES FOR EARTH-LIKE PLANETS.
